00001 C      MODIFIED T96 FOR FREE INPUT PARAMETERS, WHICH ARE
00002 C
00003 C
00004 C
00005 C
00006 C----------------------------------------------------------------------
00007 C
00008       SUBROUTINE T96MOD (IOPT,PARMOD,PS,X,Y,Z,BX,BY,BZ)
00009 C
00010 C     RELEASE DATE OF THIS VERSION:   JUNE 22, 1996.
00011 C
00012 C   DATA-BASED MODEL CALIBRATED BY (1) SOLAR WIND PRESSURE PDYN (NANOPASCALS),
00013 C     (2) DST (NANOTESLA),  (3) BYIMF, AND (4) BZIMF (NANOTESLA).
00014 C              THESE INPUT PARAMETERS SHOULD BE PLACED IN THE FIRST 4 ELEMENTS
00015 C                          OF THE ARRAY PARMOD(10).
00016 C
00017 C   THE REST OF THE INPUT VARIABLES ARE: THE GEODIPOLE TILT ANGLE PS (RADIANS),
00018 C                                        AND   X,Y,Z -  GSM POSITION (RE)
00019 C
00020 C   IOPT  IS JUST A DUMMY INPUT PARAMETER, NECESSARY TO MAKE THIS SUBROUTINE
00021 C        COMPATIBLE WITH THE NEW RELEASE (APRIL 1996) OF THE TRACING SOFTWARE
00022 C             PACKAGE (GEOPACK).   IOPT VALUE DOES NOT AFFECT THE OUTPUT FIELD.
00023 C
00024 C
00025 C  OUTPUT:  GSM COMPONENTS OF THE EXTERNAL MAGNETIC FIELD (BX,BY,BZ, NANOTESLA)
00026 C            COMPUTED AS A SUM OF CONTRIBUTIONS FROM PRINCIPAL FIELD SOURCES
00027 C
00028 C  (C) COPR. 1995, 1996, NIKOLAI A. TSYGANENKO, HUGHES STX, CODE 695, NASA GSFC
00029 C                                               GREENBELT, MD 20771, USA
00030 C
00031 C REFERENCES:  (1) N.A. TSYGANENKO AND D.P. STERN, A NEW-GENERATION GLOBAL
00032 C           MAGNETOSPHERE FIELD MODEL  , BASED ON SPACECRAFT MAGNETOMETER DATA,
00033 C           ISTP NEWSLETTER, V.6, NO.1, P.21, FEB.1996.
00034 C
00035 C              (2) N.A.TSYGANENKO,  MODELING THE EARTH'S MAGNETOSPHERIC
00036 C           MAGNETIC FIELD CONFINED WITHIN A REALISTIC MAGNETOPAUSE,
00037 C           J.GEOPHYS.RES., V.100, P. 5599, 1995.
00038 C
00039 C              (3) N.A. TSYGANENKO AND M.PEREDO, ANALYTICAL MODELS OF THE
00040 C           MAGNETIC FIELD OF DISK-SHAPED CURRENT SHEETS, J.GEOPHYS.RES.,
00041 C           V.99, P. 199, 1994.
00042 
00043 C
00044 C----------------------------------------------------------------------
00045 
00046       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00047       REAL*8 PDYN,DST,BYIMF,BZIMF,PS,X,Y,Z,BX,BY,BZ,QX,QY,QZ,PARMOD(10),
00048      *   A(9),AMDF(10)                                             !CHANGED
00049 C
00050       COMMON /CHANGES/ AMDF
00051     DATA PDYN0,EPS10 /2.,3630.7/
00052 C
00053       DATA A/1.162,22.344,18.50,2.602,6.903,5.287,0.5790,0.4462,0.7850/
00054 C
00055       DATA  AM0,S0,X00,DSIG/70.,1.08,5.48,0.005/
00056       DATA  DELIMFX,DELIMFY /20.,10./
00057 C
00058 C        WRITE(*,*) 'T96MOD: PS=', PS
00059        PDYN=PARMOD(1)
00060        DST=PARMOD(2)
00061 C       WRITE(*,*) 'DST=', DST, 'PDYN=', PDYN
00062        BYIMF=PARMOD(3)
00063        BZIMF=PARMOD(4)
00064 
00065        DMODIF=AMDF(5)                         !  HERE WE DETERMINE THE THIN CURRENT SHEET THICKNESS
00066 C
00067        SPS=SIN(PS)
00068        PPS=PS
00069 C
00070        DEPR=0.8*DST-13.*SQRT(PDYN)  !  DEPR IS AN ESTIMATE OF TOTAL NEAR-EARTH
00071 C                                         DEPRESSION, BASED ON DST AND PDYN
00072 C                                             (USUALLY, DEPR < 0 )
00073 C
00074 C  CALCULATE THE IMF-RELATED QUANTITIES:
00075 C
00076        BT=SQRT(BYIMF**2+BZIMF**2)
00077 
00078        IF (BYIMF.EQ.0..AND.BZIMF.EQ.0.) THEN
00079           THETA=0.
00080           GOTO 1
00081        ENDIF
00082 C
00083        THETA=ATAN2(BYIMF,BZIMF)
00084        IF (THETA.LE.0.D0) THETA=THETA+6.2831853
00085   1    CT=COS(THETA)
00086        ST=SIN(THETA)
00087        EPS=718.5*SQRT(PDYN)*BT*SIN(THETA/2.)
00088 C
00089        FACTEPS=EPS/EPS10-1.
00090        FACTPD=SQRT(PDYN/PDYN0)-1.
00091 C
00092        RCAMPL=-A(1)*DEPR     !   RCAMPL IS THE AMPLITUDE OF THE RING CURRENT
00093 C                  (POSITIVE AND EQUAL TO ABS.VALUE OF RC DEPRESSION AT ORIGIN)
00094 C
00095        TAMPL2=A(2)+A(3)*FACTPD+A(4)*FACTEPS
00096        TAMPL3=A(5)+A(6)*FACTPD
00097        B1AMPL=A(7)+A(8)*FACTEPS
00098        B2AMPL=20.*B1AMPL  ! IT IS EQUIVALENT TO ASSUMING THAT THE TOTAL CURRENT
00099 C                           IN THE REGION 2 SYSTEM IS 40% OF THAT IN REGION 1
00100        RECONN=A(9)
00101 C
00102        XAPPA=(PDYN/PDYN0)**0.14
00103        XAPPA3=XAPPA**3
00104        YS=Y*CT-Z*ST
00105        ZS=Z*CT+Y*ST
00106 C
00107        FACTIMF=EXP(X/DELIMFX-(YS/DELIMFY)**2)
00108 C
00109 C  CALCULATE THE "IMF" COMPONENTS OUTSIDE THE LAYER  (HENCE BEGIN WITH "O")
00110 C
00111        OIMFX=0.
00112        OIMFY=RECONN*BYIMF*FACTIMF
00113        OIMFZ=RECONN*BZIMF*FACTIMF
00114 C
00115        RIMFAMPL=RECONN*BT
00116 C
00117        PPS=PS
00118        XX=X*XAPPA
00119        YY=Y*XAPPA
00120        ZZ=Z*XAPPA
00121 C
00122 C  SCALE AND CALCULATE THE MAGNETOPAUSE PARAMETERS FOR THE INTERPOLATION ACROSS
00123 C   THE BOUNDARY LAYER (THE COORDINATES XX,YY,ZZ  ARE ALREADY SCALED)
00124 C
00125        X0=X00/XAPPA
00126        AM=AM0/XAPPA
00127        RHO2=Y**2+Z**2
00128        ASQ=AM**2
00129        XMXM=AM+X-X0
00130        IF (XMXM.LT.0.) XMXM=0. ! THE BOUNDARY IS A CYLINDER TAILWARD OF X=X0-AM
00131        AXX0=XMXM**2
00132        ARO=ASQ+RHO2
00133        SIGMA=SQRT((ARO+AXX0+SQRT((ARO+AXX0)**2-4.*ASQ*AXX0))/(2.*ASQ))
00134 C
00135 C   NOW, THERE ARE THREE POSSIBLE CASES:
00136 C    (1) INSIDE THE MAGNETOSPHERE
00137 C    (2) IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER
00138 C    (3) OUTSIDE THE MAGNETOSPHERE AND B.LAYER
00139 C       FIRST OF ALL, CONSIDER THE CASES (1) AND (2):
00140 C
00141       IF (SIGMA.LT.S0+DSIG) THEN  !  CALCULATE THE T95_06 FIELD (WITH THE
00142 C                                POTENTIAL "PENETRATED" INTERCONNECTION FIELD):
00143 
00144        CALL DIPSHLD(PPS,XX,YY,ZZ,CFX,CFY,CFZ)
00145        CALL TAILRC96(DMODIF,SPS,XX,YY,ZZ,BXRC,BYRC,BZRC,BXT2,BYT2,BZT2,
00146      *   BXT3,BYT3,BZT3,BXT2ADD,BYT2ADD,BZT2ADD)
00147        CALL BIRK1TOT_02(PPS,XX,YY,ZZ,R1X,R1Y,R1Z)
00148        CALL BIRK2TOT_02(PPS,XX,YY,ZZ,R2X,R2Y,R2Z)
00149        CALL INTERCON(XX,YS*XAPPA,ZS*XAPPA,RIMFX,RIMFYS,RIMFZS)
00150        RIMFY=RIMFYS*CT+RIMFZS*ST
00151        RIMFZ=RIMFZS*CT-RIMFYS*ST
00152 C
00153       FX=CFX*XAPPA3+RCAMPL*AMDF(1)*BXRC +TAMPL2*AMDF(2)*BXT2+          !CHANGED
00154      1  TAMPL2*AMDF(4)*BXT2ADD+                                        !CHANGED (ADDITIONAL CS)
00155      2 TAMPL3*AMDF(3)*BXT3 +B1AMPL*R1X +B2AMPL*R2X +RIMFAMPL*RIMFX     !CHANGED
00156       FY=CFY*XAPPA3+RCAMPL*AMDF(1)*BYRC +TAMPL2*AMDF(2)*BYT2+
00157      1  TAMPL2*AMDF(4)*BYT2ADD+                                        !CHANGED
00158      2  TAMPL3*AMDF(3)*BYT3+B1AMPL*R1Y +B2AMPL*R2Y +RIMFAMPL*RIMFY     !CHANGED
00159       FZ=CFZ*XAPPA3+RCAMPL*AMDF(1)*BZRC +TAMPL2*AMDF(2)*BZT2+
00160      1   TAMPL2*AMDF(4)*BZT2ADD+                                       !CHANGED
00161      2  TAMPL3*AMDF(3)*BZT3+B1AMPL*R1Z +B2AMPL*R2Z +RIMFAMPL*RIMFZ     !CHANGED
00162 C
00163 C  NOW, LET US CHECK WHETHER WE HAVE THE CASE (1). IF YES - WE ARE DONE:
00164 C
00165        IF (SIGMA.LT.S0-DSIG) THEN
00166          BX=FX
00167          BY=FY
00168          BZ=FZ
00169                         ELSE  !  THIS IS THE MOST COMPLEX CASE: WE ARE INSIDE
00170 C                                         THE INTERPOLATION REGION
00171        FINT=0.5*(1.-(SIGMA-S0)/DSIG)
00172        FEXT=0.5*(1.+(SIGMA-S0)/DSIG)
00173 C
00174        CALL T96MOD_DIPOLE(PS,X,Y,Z,QX,QY,QZ)
00175        BX=(FX+QX)*FINT+OIMFX*FEXT -QX
00176        BY=(FY+QY)*FINT+OIMFY*FEXT -QY
00177        BZ=(FZ+QZ)*FINT+OIMFZ*FEXT -QZ
00178 C
00179         ENDIF  !   THE CASES (1) AND (2) ARE EXHAUSTED; THE ONLY REMAINING
00180 C                      POSSIBILITY IS NOW THE CASE (3):
00181          ELSE
00182                 CALL T96MOD_DIPOLE(PS,X,Y,Z,QX,QY,QZ)
00183                 BX=OIMFX-QX
00184                 BY=OIMFY-QY
00185                 BZ=OIMFZ-QZ
00186          ENDIF
00187 C       WRITE(*,*) '**** T96MOD: Bx, BY, BZ = ',  Bx, BY, BZ
00188 C
00189        RETURN
00190        END
00191 C=====================================================================
00192 
00193 C  ORIGINAL T96_01!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
00194 
00195 C----------------------------------------------------------------------
00196 C
00197       SUBROUTINE T96_01 (IOPT,PARMOD,PS,X,Y,Z,BX,BY,BZ)
00198 C
00199 C     RELEASE DATE OF THIS VERSION:   JUNE 22, 1996.
00200 C
00201 C   DATA-BASED MODEL CALIBRATED BY (1) SOLAR WIND PRESSURE PDYN (NANOPASCALS),
00202 C     (2) DST (NANOTESLA),  (3) BYIMF, AND (4) BZIMF (NANOTESLA). 
00203 C              THESE INPUT PARAMETERS SHOULD BE PLACED IN THE FIRST 4 ELEMENTS
00204 C                          OF THE ARRAY PARMOD(10).
00205 C
00206 C   THE REST OF THE INPUT VARIABLES ARE: THE GEODIPOLE TILT ANGLE PS (RADIANS),
00207 C                                        AND   X,Y,Z -  GSM POSITION (RE)
00208 C
00209 C   IOPT  IS JUST A DUMMY INPUT PARAMETER, NECESSARY TO MAKE THIS SUBROUTINE
00210 C        COMPATIBLE WITH THE NEW RELEASE (APRIL 1996) OF THE TRACING SOFTWARE 
00211 C             PACKAGE (GEOPACK).   IOPT VALUE DOES NOT AFFECT THE OUTPUT FIELD.
00212 C
00213 C
00214 C  OUTPUT:  GSM COMPONENTS OF THE EXTERNAL MAGNETIC FIELD (BX,BY,BZ, NANOTESLA)
00215 C            COMPUTED AS A SUM OF CONTRIBUTIONS FROM PRINCIPAL FIELD SOURCES 
00216 C
00217 C  (C) COPR. 1995, 1996, NIKOLAI A. TSYGANENKO, HUGHES STX, CODE 695, NASA GSFC
00218 C                                               GREENBELT, MD 20771, USA
00219 C
00220 C REFERENCES:  (1) N.A. TSYGANENKO AND D.P. STERN, A NEW-GENERATION GLOBAL
00221 C           MAGNETOSPHERE FIELD MODEL  , BASED ON SPACECRAFT MAGNETOMETER DATA,
00222 C           ISTP NEWSLETTER, V.6, NO.1, P.21, FEB.1996.
00223 C
00224 C              (2) N.A.TSYGANENKO,  MODELING THE EARTH'S MAGNETOSPHERIC 
00225 C           MAGNETIC FIELD CONFINED WITHIN A REALISTIC MAGNETOPAUSE, 
00226 C           J.GEOPHYS.RES., V.100, P. 5599, 1995.
00227 C
00228 C              (3) N.A. TSYGANENKO AND M.PEREDO, ANALYTICAL MODELS OF THE
00229 C           MAGNETIC FIELD OF DISK-SHAPED CURRENT SHEETS, J.GEOPHYS.RES., 
00230 C           V.99, P. 199, 1994.
00231 
00232 C
00233 C----------------------------------------------------------------------
00234 
00235       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00236       REAL*8 PDYN,DST,BYIMF,BZIMF,PS,X,Y,Z,BX,BY,BZ,QX,QY,QZ,PARMOD(10),
00237      *   A(9)
00238 C
00239       DATA PDYN0,EPS10 /2.,3630.7/
00240 C
00241       DATA A/1.162,22.344,18.50,2.602,6.903,5.287,0.5790,0.4462,0.7850/
00242 C
00243       DATA  AM0,S0,X00,DSIG/70.,1.08,5.48,0.005/
00244       DATA  DELIMFX,DELIMFY /20.,10./  
00245 C
00246        PDYN=PARMOD(1)
00247        DST=PARMOD(2)
00248        BYIMF=PARMOD(3)
00249        BZIMF=PARMOD(4)
00250 C
00251        SPS=SIN(PS)
00252        PPS=PS
00253 C
00254        DEPR=0.8*DST-13.*SQRT(PDYN)  !  DEPR IS AN ESTIMATE OF TOTAL NEAR-EARTH
00255 C                                         DEPRESSION, BASED ON DST AND PDYN
00256 C                                             (USUALLY, DEPR < 0 )
00257 C
00258 C  CALCULATE THE IMF-RELATED QUANTITIES:
00259 C
00260        BT=SQRT(BYIMF**2+BZIMF**2)
00261 
00262        IF (BYIMF.EQ.0..AND.BZIMF.EQ.0.) THEN
00263           THETA=0.
00264           GOTO 1
00265        ENDIF
00266 C
00267        THETA=ATAN2(BYIMF,BZIMF)
00268        IF (THETA.LE.0.D0) THETA=THETA+6.2831853       
00269   1    CT=COS(THETA)
00270        ST=SIN(THETA)
00271        EPS=718.5*SQRT(PDYN)*BT*SIN(THETA/2.)
00272 C
00273        FACTEPS=EPS/EPS10-1.
00274        FACTPD=SQRT(PDYN/PDYN0)-1.
00275 C
00276        RCAMPL=-A(1)*DEPR     !   RCAMPL IS THE AMPLITUDE OF THE RING CURRENT
00277 C                  (POSITIVE AND EQUAL TO ABS.VALUE OF RC DEPRESSION AT ORIGIN)
00278 C
00279        TAMPL2=A(2)+A(3)*FACTPD+A(4)*FACTEPS
00280        TAMPL3=A(5)+A(6)*FACTPD
00281        B1AMPL=A(7)+A(8)*FACTEPS
00282        B2AMPL=20.*B1AMPL  ! IT IS EQUIVALENT TO ASSUMING THAT THE TOTAL CURRENT
00283 C                           IN THE REGION 2 SYSTEM IS 40% OF THAT IN REGION 1
00284        RECONN=A(9)
00285 C
00286        XAPPA=(PDYN/PDYN0)**0.14
00287        XAPPA3=XAPPA**3
00288        YS=Y*CT-Z*ST
00289        ZS=Z*CT+Y*ST
00290 C
00291        FACTIMF=EXP(X/DELIMFX-(YS/DELIMFY)**2)
00292 C
00293 C  CALCULATE THE "IMF" COMPONENTS OUTSIDE THE LAYER  (HENCE BEGIN WITH "O") 
00294 C
00295        OIMFX=0.
00296        OIMFY=RECONN*BYIMF*FACTIMF
00297        OIMFZ=RECONN*BZIMF*FACTIMF
00298 C
00299        RIMFAMPL=RECONN*BT
00300 C
00301        PPS=PS
00302        XX=X*XAPPA
00303        YY=Y*XAPPA
00304        ZZ=Z*XAPPA
00305 C
00306 C  SCALE AND CALCULATE THE MAGNETOPAUSE PARAMETERS FOR THE INTERPOLATION ACROSS
00307 C   THE BOUNDARY LAYER (THE COORDINATES XX,YY,ZZ  ARE ALREADY SCALED)
00308 C
00309        X0=X00/XAPPA
00310        AM=AM0/XAPPA
00311        RHO2=Y**2+Z**2
00312        ASQ=AM**2
00313        XMXM=AM+X-X0
00314        IF (XMXM.LT.0.) XMXM=0. ! THE BOUNDARY IS A CYLINDER TAILWARD OF X=X0-AM
00315        AXX0=XMXM**2
00316        ARO=ASQ+RHO2
00317        SIGMA=SQRT((ARO+AXX0+SQRT((ARO+AXX0)**2-4.*ASQ*AXX0))/(2.*ASQ))
00318 C
00319 C   NOW, THERE ARE THREE POSSIBLE CASES:
00320 C    (1) INSIDE THE MAGNETOSPHERE 
00321 C    (2) IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER
00322 C    (3) OUTSIDE THE MAGNETOSPHERE AND B.LAYER
00323 C       FIRST OF ALL, CONSIDER THE CASES (1) AND (2):
00324 C
00325       IF (SIGMA.LT.S0+DSIG) THEN  !  CALCULATE THE T95_06 FIELD (WITH THE
00326 C                                POTENTIAL "PENETRATED" INTERCONNECTION FIELD):
00327 
00328        CALL DIPSHLD(PPS,XX,YY,ZZ,CFX,CFY,CFZ)
00329        CALL TAILRC96(0.D0,SPS,XX,YY,ZZ,BXRC,BYRC,BZRC,BXT2,BYT2,BZT2,
00330      *   BXT3,BYT3,BZT3,BXT2ADD,BYT2ADD,BZT2ADD)
00331        CALL BIRK1TOT_02(PPS,XX,YY,ZZ,R1X,R1Y,R1Z)
00332        CALL BIRK2TOT_02(PPS,XX,YY,ZZ,R2X,R2Y,R2Z)
00333        CALL INTERCON(XX,YS*XAPPA,ZS*XAPPA,RIMFX,RIMFYS,RIMFZS)
00334        RIMFY=RIMFYS*CT+RIMFZS*ST
00335        RIMFZ=RIMFZS*CT-RIMFYS*ST
00336 C
00337       FX=CFX*XAPPA3+RCAMPL*BXRC +TAMPL2*BXT2+TAMPL3*BXT3
00338      *  +B1AMPL*R1X +B2AMPL*R2X +RIMFAMPL*RIMFX
00339       FY=CFY*XAPPA3+RCAMPL*BYRC +TAMPL2*BYT2+TAMPL3*BYT3
00340      *  +B1AMPL*R1Y +B2AMPL*R2Y +RIMFAMPL*RIMFY
00341       FZ=CFZ*XAPPA3+RCAMPL*BZRC +TAMPL2*BZT2+TAMPL3*BZT3
00342      *  +B1AMPL*R1Z +B2AMPL*R2Z +RIMFAMPL*RIMFZ
00343 C
00344 C  NOW, LET US CHECK WHETHER WE HAVE THE CASE (1). IF YES - WE ARE DONE:
00345 C
00346        IF (SIGMA.LT.S0-DSIG) THEN  
00347          BX=FX
00348          BY=FY
00349          BZ=FZ
00350                         ELSE  !  THIS IS THE MOST COMPLEX CASE: WE ARE INSIDE
00351 C                                         THE INTERPOLATION REGION
00352        FINT=0.5*(1.-(SIGMA-S0)/DSIG)
00353        FEXT=0.5*(1.+(SIGMA-S0)/DSIG)
00354 C
00355        CALL T96MOD_DIPOLE(PS,X,Y,Z,QX,QY,QZ)
00356        BX=(FX+QX)*FINT+OIMFX*FEXT -QX
00357        BY=(FY+QY)*FINT+OIMFY*FEXT -QY
00358        BZ=(FZ+QZ)*FINT+OIMFZ*FEXT -QZ
00359 C
00360         ENDIF  !   THE CASES (1) AND (2) ARE EXHAUSTED; THE ONLY REMAINING 
00361 C                      POSSIBILITY IS NOW THE CASE (3):
00362          ELSE
00363                 CALL T96MOD_DIPOLE(PS,X,Y,Z,QX,QY,QZ)
00364                 BX=OIMFX-QX
00365                 BY=OIMFY-QY
00366                 BZ=OIMFZ-QZ
00367          ENDIF
00368 C
00369        RETURN
00370        END
00371 C=====================================================================
00372 
00373 
00374 
00375       SUBROUTINE DIPSHLD(PS,X,Y,Z,BX,BY,BZ)
00376 C
00377 C   CALCULATES GSM COMPONENTS OF THE EXTERNAL MAGNETIC FIELD DUE TO
00378 C    SHIELDING OF THE EARTH'S DIPOLE ONLY
00379 C
00380        IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00381        DIMENSION A1(12),A2(12)
00382       DATA A1 /.24777,-27.003,-.46815,7.0637,-1.5918,-.90317E-01,57.522,
00383      * 13.757,2.0100,10.458,4.5798,2.1695/
00384       DATA A2/-.65385,-18.061,-.40457,-5.0995,1.2846,.78231E-01,39.592,
00385      * 13.291,1.9970,10.062,4.5140,2.1558/
00386 C
00387           CPS=DCOS(PS)
00388           SPS=DSIN(PS)
00389           CALL CYLHARM(A1,X,Y,Z,HX,HY,HZ)
00390           CALL CYLHAR1(A2,X,Y,Z,FX,FY,FZ)
00391 C
00392           BX=HX*CPS+FX*SPS
00393           BY=HY*CPS+FY*SPS
00394           BZ=HZ*CPS+FZ*SPS
00395         RETURN
00396        END
00397 C
00398 C+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
00399 C
00400 C  THIS CODE YIELDS THE SHIELDING FIELD FOR THE PERPENDICULAR DIPOLE
00401 C
00402          SUBROUTINE  CYLHARM( A, X,Y,Z, BX,BY,BZ)
00403 C
00404 C
00405 C   ***  N.A. TSYGANENKO ***  SEPT. 14-18, 1993; REVISED MARCH 16, 1994 ***
00406 C
00407 C   AN APPROXIMATION FOR THE CHAPMAN-FERRARO FIELD BY A SUM OF 6 CYLIN-
00408 C   DRICAL HARMONICS (SEE PP. 97-113 IN THE BROWN GSFC NOTEBOOK #1)
00409 C
00410 C      DESCRIPTION OF PARAMETERS:
00411 C
00412 C  A   - INPUT VECTOR CONTAINING MODEL PARAMETERS;
00413 C  X,Y,Z   -  INPUT GSM COORDINATES
00414 C  BX,BY,BZ - OUTPUT GSM COMPONENTS OF THE SHIELDING FIELD
00415 C - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
00416 C  THE 6 LINEAR PARAMETERS A(1)-A(6) ARE AMPLITUDES OF THE CYLINDRICAL HARMONIC
00417 C       TERMS.
00418 C  THE 6 NONLINEAR PARAMETERS A(7)-A(12) ARE THE CORRESPONDING SCALE LENGTHS
00419 C       FOR EACH TERM (SEE GSFC BROWN NOTEBOOK).
00420 C
00421 C - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
00422 C
00423      IMPLICIT  REAL * 8  (A - H, O - Z)
00424 C
00425      DIMENSION  A(12)
00426 C
00427            RHO=DSQRT(Y**2+Z**2)
00428             IF (RHO.LT.1.D-8) THEN
00429                SINFI=1.D0
00430                COSFI=0.D0
00431                RHO=1.D-8
00432                GOTO 1
00433             ENDIF
00434 C
00435            SINFI=Z/RHO
00436            COSFI=Y/RHO
00437   1        SINFI2=SINFI**2
00438            SI2CO2=SINFI2-COSFI**2
00439 C
00440              BX=0.D0
00441              BY=0.D0
00442              BZ=0.D0
00443 C
00444        DO 11 I=1,3
00445              DZETA=RHO/A(I+6)
00446              XJ0=BES(DZETA,0)
00447              XJ1=BES(DZETA,1)
00448              XEXP=DEXP(X/A(I+6))
00449              BX=BX-A(I)*XJ1*XEXP*SINFI
00450              BY=BY+A(I)*(2.D0*XJ1/DZETA-XJ0)*XEXP*SINFI*COSFI
00451              BZ=BZ+A(I)*(XJ1/DZETA*SI2CO2-XJ0*SINFI2)*XEXP
00452    11        CONTINUE
00453 C
00454        DO 12 I=4,6
00455              DZETA=RHO/A(I+6)
00456              XKSI=X/A(I+6)
00457              XJ0=BES(DZETA,0)
00458              XJ1=BES(DZETA,1)
00459              XEXP=DEXP(XKSI)
00460              BRHO=(XKSI*XJ0-(DZETA**2+XKSI-1.D0)*XJ1/DZETA)*XEXP*SINFI
00461              BPHI=(XJ0+XJ1/DZETA*(XKSI-1.D0))*XEXP*COSFI
00462              BX=BX+A(I)*(DZETA*XJ0+XKSI*XJ1)*XEXP*SINFI
00463              BY=BY+A(I)*(BRHO*COSFI-BPHI*SINFI)
00464              BZ=BZ+A(I)*(BRHO*SINFI+BPHI*COSFI)
00465    12        CONTINUE
00466 C
00467 C
00468          RETURN
00469      END
00470 C
00471 C%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00472 C
00473 C  THIS CODE YIELDS THE SHIELDING FIELD FOR THE PARALLEL DIPOLE
00474 C
00475          SUBROUTINE  CYLHAR1(A, X,Y,Z, BX,BY,BZ)
00476 C
00477 C
00478 C   ***  N.A. TSYGANENKO ***  SEPT. 14-18, 1993; REVISED MARCH 16, 1994 ***
00479 C
00480 C   AN APPROXIMATION OF THE CHAPMAN-FERRARO FIELD BY A SUM OF 6 CYLIN-
00481 C   DRICAL HARMONICS (SEE PAGES 97-113 IN THE BROWN GSFC NOTEBOOK #1)
00482 C
00483 C      DESCRIPTION OF PARAMETERS:
00484 C
00485 C  A   - INPUT VECTOR CONTAINING MODEL PARAMETERS;
00486 C  X,Y,Z - INPUT GSM COORDINATES,
00487 C  BX,BY,BZ - OUTPUT GSM COMPONENTS OF THE SHIELDING FIELD
00488 C
00489 C - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
00490 C
00491 C      THE 6 LINEAR PARAMETERS A(1)-A(6) ARE AMPLITUDES OF THE CYLINDRICAL
00492 C  HARMONIC TERMS.
00493 C      THE 6 NONLINEAR PARAMETERS A(7)-A(12) ARE THE CORRESPONDING SCALE
00494 C  LENGTHS FOR EACH TERM (SEE GSFC BROWN NOTEBOOK).
00495 C
00496 C - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
00497 C
00498      IMPLICIT  REAL * 8  (A - H, O - Z)
00499 C
00500      DIMENSION  A(12)
00501 C
00502            RHO=DSQRT(Y**2+Z**2)
00503             IF (RHO.LT.1.D-10) THEN
00504                SINFI=1.D0
00505                COSFI=0.D0
00506                GOTO 1
00507             ENDIF
00508 C
00509            SINFI=Z/RHO
00510            COSFI=Y/RHO
00511 C
00512    1      BX=0.D0
00513           BY=0.D0
00514           BZ=0.D0
00515 C
00516              DO 11 I=1,3
00517              DZETA=RHO/A(I+6)
00518              XKSI=X/A(I+6)
00519              XJ0=BES(DZETA,0)
00520              XJ1=BES(DZETA,1)
00521              XEXP=DEXP(XKSI)
00522              BRHO=XJ1*XEXP
00523              BX=BX-A(I)*XJ0*XEXP
00524              BY=BY+A(I)*BRHO*COSFI
00525              BZ=BZ+A(I)*BRHO*SINFI
00526    11        CONTINUE
00527 C
00528        DO 12 I=4,6
00529              DZETA=RHO/A(I+6)
00530              XKSI=X/A(I+6)
00531              XJ0=BES(DZETA,0)
00532              XJ1=BES(DZETA,1)
00533              XEXP=DEXP(XKSI)
00534              BRHO=(DZETA*XJ0+XKSI*XJ1)*XEXP
00535              BX=BX+A(I)*(DZETA*XJ1-XJ0*(XKSI+1.D0))*XEXP
00536              BY=BY+A(I)*BRHO*COSFI
00537              BZ=BZ+A(I)*BRHO*SINFI
00538    12        CONTINUE
00539 C
00540          RETURN
00541      END
00542 
00543 C%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00544 C
00545       DOUBLE PRECISION FUNCTION BES(X,K)
00546       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00547 C
00548       IF (K.EQ.0) THEN
00549         BES=BES0(X)
00550         RETURN
00551       ENDIF
00552 C
00553       IF (K.EQ.1) THEN
00554         BES=BES1(X)
00555         RETURN
00556       ENDIF
00557 C
00558       IF (X.EQ.0.D0) THEN
00559         BES=0.D0
00560         RETURN
00561       ENDIF
00562 C
00563       G=2.D0/X
00564       IF (X.LE.DFLOAT(K)) GOTO 10
00565 C
00566       N=1
00567       XJN=BES1(X)
00568       XJNM1=BES0(X)
00569 C
00570   1   XJNP1=G*N*XJN-XJNM1
00571       N=N+1
00572       IF (N.LT.K) GOTO 2
00573       BES=XJNP1
00574       RETURN
00575 C
00576  2    XJNM1=XJN
00577       XJN=XJNP1
00578       GOTO 1
00579 C
00580  10   N=24
00581       XJN=1.D0
00582       XJNP1=0.D0
00583       SUM=0.D0
00584 C
00585   3   IF (MOD(N,2).EQ.0) SUM=SUM+XJN
00586       XJNM1=G*N*XJN-XJNP1
00587       N=N-1
00588 C
00589       XJNP1=XJN
00590       XJN=XJNM1
00591       IF (N.EQ.K) BES=XJN
00592 C
00593       IF (DABS(XJN).GT.1.D5) THEN
00594         XJNP1=XJNP1*1.D-5
00595         XJN=XJN*1.D-5
00596         SUM=SUM*1.D-5
00597         IF (N.LE.K) BES=BES*1.D-5
00598       ENDIF
00599 C
00600       IF (N.EQ.0) GOTO 4
00601       GOTO 3
00602 C
00603   4   SUM=XJN+2.D0*SUM
00604       BES=BES/SUM
00605       RETURN
00606       END
00607 C-------------------------------------------------------------------
00608 C
00609        DOUBLE PRECISION FUNCTION BES0(X)
00610 C
00611         IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00612 C
00613         IF (DABS(X).LT.3.D0) THEN
00614           X32=(X/3.D0)**2
00615           BES0=1.D0-X32*(2.2499997D0-X32*(1.2656208D0-X32*
00616      *    (0.3163866D0-X32*(0.0444479D0-X32*(0.0039444D0
00617      *     -X32*0.00021D0)))))
00618         ELSE
00619         XD3=3.D0/X
00620         F0=0.79788456D0-XD3*(0.00000077D0+XD3*(0.00552740D0+XD3*
00621      *   (0.00009512D0-XD3*(0.00137237D0-XD3*(0.00072805D0
00622      *   -XD3*0.00014476D0)))))
00623         T0=X-0.78539816D0-XD3*(0.04166397D0+XD3*(0.00003954D0-XD3*
00624      *   (0.00262573D0-XD3*(0.00054125D0+XD3*(0.00029333D0
00625      *   -XD3*0.00013558D0)))))
00626         BES0=F0/DSQRT(X)*DCOS(T0)
00627        ENDIF
00628        RETURN
00629        END
00630 C
00631 C--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00632 C
00633        DOUBLE PRECISION FUNCTION BES1(X)
00634 C
00635         IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00636 C
00637        IF (DABS(X).LT.3.D0) THEN
00638         X32=(X/3.D0)**2
00639         BES1XM1=0.5D0-X32*(0.56249985D0-X32*(0.21093573D0-X32*
00640      *  (0.03954289D0-X32*(0.00443319D0-X32*(0.00031761D0
00641      *  -X32*0.00001109D0)))))
00642          BES1=BES1XM1*X
00643        ELSE
00644         XD3=3.D0/X
00645         F1=0.79788456D0+XD3*(0.00000156D0+XD3*(0.01659667D0+XD3*
00646      *   (0.00017105D0-XD3*(0.00249511D0-XD3*(0.00113653D0
00647      *   -XD3*0.00020033D0)))))
00648         T1=X-2.35619449D0+XD3*(0.12499612D0+XD3*(0.0000565D0-XD3*
00649      *   (0.00637879D0-XD3*(0.00074348D0+XD3*(0.00079824D0
00650      *   -XD3*0.00029166D0)))))
00651         BES1=F1/DSQRT(X)*DCOS(T1)
00652        ENDIF
00653        RETURN
00654        END
00655 C------------------------------------------------------------
00656 C
00657          SUBROUTINE INTERCON(X,Y,Z,BX,BY,BZ)
00658 C
00659 C      CALCULATES THE POTENTIAL INTERCONNECTION FIELD INSIDE THE MAGNETOSPHERE,
00660 C  CORRESPONDING TO  DELTA_X = 20RE AND DELTA_Y = 10RE (NB#3, P.90, 6/6/1996).
00661 C  THE POSITION (X,Y,Z) AND FIELD COMPONENTS BX,BY,BZ ARE GIVEN IN THE ROTATED
00662 C   COORDINATE SYSTEM, IN WHICH THE Z-AXIS IS ALWAYS DIRECTED ALONG THE BZIMF
00663 C   (I.E. ROTATED BY THE IMF CLOCK ANGLE THETA)
00664 C   IT IS ALSO ASSUMED THAT THE IMF BT=1, SO THAT THE COMPONENTS SHOULD BE
00665 C     (I) MULTIPLIED BY THE ACTUAL BT, AND
00666 C     (II) TRANSFORMED TO STANDARD GSM COORDS BY ROTATING BACK AROUND X AXIS
00667 C              BY THE ANGLE -THETA.
00668 C
00669 C      DESCRIPTION OF PARAMETERS:
00670 C
00671 C     X,Y,Z -   GSM POSITION
00672 C      BX,BY,BZ - INTERCONNECTION FIELD COMPONENTS INSIDE THE MAGNETOSPHERE
00673 C        OF A STANDARD SIZE (TO TAKE INTO ACCOUNT EFFECTS OF PRESSURE CHANGES,
00674 C         APPLY THE SCALING TRANSFORMATION)
00675 C
00676 C - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
00677 C
00678 C     THE 9 LINEAR PARAMETERS ARE AMPLITUDES OF THE "CARTESIAN" HARMONICS
00679 C     THE 6 NONLINEAR PARAMETERS ARE THE SCALES PI AND RI ENTERING
00680 C    THE ARGUMENTS OF EXPONENTS, SINES, AND COSINES IN THE 9 "CARTESIAN"
00681 C       HARMONICS (3+3)
00682 C - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
00683 C
00684      IMPLICIT  REAL * 8  (A - H, O - Z)
00685 C
00686         DIMENSION A(15),RP(3),RR(3),P(3),R(3)
00687 C
00688       DATA A/-8.411078731,5932254.951,-9073284.93,-11.68794634,
00689      * 6027598.824,-9218378.368,-6.508798398,-11824.42793,18015.66212,
00690      * 7.99754043,13.9669886,90.24475036,16.75728834,1015.645781,
00691      * 1553.493216/
00692 C
00693         DATA M/0/
00694 C
00695         IF (M.NE.0) GOTO 111
00696         M=1
00697 C
00698          P(1)=A(10)
00699          P(2)=A(11)
00700          P(3)=A(12)
00701          R(1)=A(13)
00702          R(2)=A(14)
00703          R(3)=A(15)
00704 C
00705 C
00706            DO 11 I=1,3
00707             RP(I)=1.D0/P(I)
00708   11        RR(I)=1.D0/R(I)
00709 C
00710   111   CONTINUE
00711 C
00712             L=0
00713 C
00714                BX=0.
00715                BY=0.
00716                BZ=0.
00717 C
00718 C        "PERPENDICULAR" KIND OF SYMMETRY ONLY
00719 C
00720                DO 2 I=1,3
00721                   CYPI=DCOS(Y*RP(I))
00722                   SYPI=DSIN(Y*RP(I))
00723 C
00724                 DO 2 K=1,3
00725                    SZRK=DSIN(Z*RR(K))
00726                    CZRK=DCOS(Z*RR(K))
00727                      SQPR=DSQRT(RP(I)**2+RR(K)**2)
00728                       EPR=DEXP(X*SQPR)
00729 C
00730                      HX=-SQPR*EPR*CYPI*SZRK
00731                      HY=RP(I)*EPR*SYPI*SZRK
00732                      HZ=-RR(K)*EPR*CYPI*CZRK
00733              L=L+1
00734 C
00735           BX=BX+A(L)*HX
00736           BY=BY+A(L)*HY
00737           BZ=BZ+A(L)*HZ
00738   2   CONTINUE
00739 C
00740       RETURN
00741       END
00742 
00743 C~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
00744       SUBROUTINE TAILRC96(DMODIF,SPS,X,Y,Z,BXRC,BYRC,BZRC,BXT2,BYT2,
00745      *  BZT2, BXT3,BYT3,BZT3,BXT2ADD,BYT2ADD,BZT2ADD)
00746 C
00747 C  COMPUTES THE COMPONENTS OF THE FIELD OF THE MODEL RING CURRENT AND THREE
00748 C                   TAIL MODES WITH UNIT AMPLITUDES
00749 C      (FOR THE RING CURRENT, IT MEANS THE DISTURBANCE OF BZ=-1NT AT ORIGIN,
00750 C   AND FOR THE TAIL MODES IT MEANS MAXIMAL BX JUST ABOVE THE SHEET EQUAL 1 NT.
00751 C
00752          IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00753          DIMENSION ARC(48),ATAIL2(48),ATAIL3(48)
00754          COMMON /WARP/ CPSS,SPSS,DPSRR,RPS,WARP,D,XS,ZS,DXSX,DXSY,DXSZ,
00755      *   DZSX,DZSY,DZSZ,DZETAS,DDZETADX,DDZETADY,DDZETADZ,ZSWW
00756 C
00757          DATA ARC/-3.087699646,3.516259114,18.81380577,-13.95772338,
00758      *  -5.497076303,0.1712890838,2.392629189,-2.728020808,-14.79349936,
00759      *  11.08738083,4.388174084,0.2492163197E-01,0.7030375685,
00760      *-.7966023165,-3.835041334,2.642228681,-0.2405352424,-0.7297705678,
00761      * -0.3680255045,0.1333685557,2.795140897,-1.078379954,0.8014028630,
00762      * 0.1245825565,0.6149982835,-0.2207267314,-4.424578723,1.730471572,
00763      * -1.716313926,-0.2306302941,-0.2450342688,0.8617173961E-01,
00764      *  1.54697858,-0.6569391113,-0.6537525353,0.2079417515,12.75434981,
00765      *  11.37659788,636.4346279,1.752483754,3.604231143,12.83078674,
00766      * 7.412066636,9.434625736,676.7557193,1.701162737,3.580307144,
00767      *  14.64298662/
00768 C
00769         DATA ATAIL2/.8747515218,-.9116821411,2.209365387,-2.159059518,
00770      * -7.059828867,5.924671028,-1.916935691,1.996707344,-3.877101873,
00771      * 3.947666061,11.38715899,-8.343210833,1.194109867,-1.244316975,
00772      * 3.73895491,-4.406522465,-20.66884863,3.020952989,.2189908481,
00773      * -.09942543549,-.927225562,.1555224669,.6994137909,-.08111721003,
00774      * -.7565493881,.4686588792,4.266058082,-.3717470262,-3.920787807,
00775      * .02298569870,.7039506341,-.5498352719,-6.675140817,.8279283559,
00776      * -2.234773608,-1.622656137,5.187666221,6.802472048,39.13543412,
00777      *  2.784722096,6.979576616,25.71716760,4.495005873,8.068408272,
00778      * 93.47887103,4.158030104,9.313492566,57.18240483/
00779 C
00780         DATA ATAIL3/-19091.95061,-3011.613928,20582.16203,4242.918430,
00781      * -2377.091102,-1504.820043,19884.04650,2725.150544,-21389.04845,
00782      * -3990.475093,2401.610097,1548.171792,-946.5493963,490.1528941,
00783      * 986.9156625,-489.3265930,-67.99278499,8.711175710,-45.15734260,
00784      * -10.76106500,210.7927312,11.41764141,-178.0262808,.7558830028,
00785      *  339.3806753,9.904695974,69.50583193,-118.0271581,22.85935896,
00786      * 45.91014857,-425.6607164,15.47250738,118.2988915,65.58594397,
00787      * -201.4478068,-14.57062940,19.69877970,20.30095680,86.45407420,
00788      * 22.50403727,23.41617329,48.48140573,24.61031329,123.5395974,
00789      * 223.5367692,39.50824342,65.83385762,266.2948657/
00790 C
00791        DATA RH,DR,G,D0,DELTADY/9.,4.,10.,2.,10./
00792 C
00793 C   TO ECONOMIZE THE CODE, WE FIRST CALCULATE COMMON VARIABLES, WHICH ARE
00794 C      THE SAME FOR ALL MODES, AND PUT THEM IN THE COMMON-BLOCK /WARP/
00795 C
00796        DR2=DR*DR
00797        C11=DSQRT((1.D0+RH)**2+DR2)
00798        C12=DSQRT((1.D0-RH)**2+DR2)
00799        C1=C11-C12
00800        SPSC1=SPS/C1
00801        RPS=0.5*(C11+C12)*SPS  !  THIS IS THE SHIFT OF OF THE SHEET WITH RESPECT
00802 C                            TO GSM EQ.PLANE FOR THE 3RD (ASYMPTOTIC) TAIL MODE
00803 C
00804         R=DSQRT(X*X+Y*Y+Z*Z)
00805         SQ1=DSQRT((R+RH)**2+DR2)
00806         SQ2=DSQRT((R-RH)**2+DR2)
00807         C=SQ1-SQ2
00808         CS=(R+RH)/SQ1-(R-RH)/SQ2
00809         SPSS=SPSC1/R*C
00810         CPSS=DSQRT(1.D0-SPSS**2)
00811         DPSRR=SPS/(R*R)*(CS*R-C)/DSQRT((R*C1)**2-(C*SPS)**2)
00812 C
00813         WFAC=Y/(Y**4+1.D4)   !   WARPING
00814         W=WFAC*Y**3
00815         WS=4.D4*Y*WFAC**2
00816         WARP=G*SPS*W
00817         XS=X*CPSS-Z*SPSS
00818         ZSWW=Z*CPSS+X*SPSS  ! "WW" MEANS "WITHOUT Y-Z WARPING" (IN X-Z ONLY)
00819         ZS=ZSWW +WARP
00820 
00821         DXSX=CPSS-X*ZSWW*DPSRR
00822         DXSY=-Y*ZSWW*DPSRR
00823         DXSZ=-SPSS-Z*ZSWW*DPSRR
00824         DZSX=SPSS+X*XS*DPSRR
00825         DZSY=XS*Y*DPSRR  +G*SPS*WS  !  THE LAST TERM IS FOR THE Y-Z WARP
00826         DZSZ=CPSS+XS*Z*DPSRR        !      (TAIL MODES ONLY)
00827 
00828         D=D0+DELTADY*(Y/20.D0)**2   !  SHEET HALF-THICKNESS FOR THE TAIL MODES
00829         DDDY=DELTADY*Y*0.005D0      !  (THICKENS TO FLANKS, BUT NO VARIATION
00830 C                                         ALONG X, IN CONTRAST TO RING CURRENT)
00831 C
00832         DZETAS=DSQRT(ZS**2+D**2)  !  THIS IS THE SAME SIMPLE WAY TO SPREAD
00833 C                                        OUT THE SHEET, AS THAT USED IN T89
00834         DDZETADX=ZS*DZSX/DZETAS
00835         DDZETADY=(ZS*DZSY+D*DDDY)/DZETAS
00836         DDZETADZ=ZS*DZSZ/DZETAS
00837 C
00838         CALL T96MOD_SHLCAR3X3(ARC,X,Y,Z,SPS,WX,WY,WZ)
00839         CALL RINGCURR96(X,Y,Z,HX,HY,HZ)
00840         BXRC=WX+HX
00841         BYRC=WY+HY
00842         BZRC=WZ+HZ
00843 C
00844         CALL T96MOD_SHLCAR3X3(ATAIL2,X,Y,Z,SPS,WX,WY,WZ)
00845         CALL T96MOD_TAILDISK(X,Y,Z,HX,HY,HZ)
00846       BXT2=WX+HX
00847         BYT2=WY+HY
00848         BZT2=WZ+HZ
00849 C
00850       IF(DMODIF.NE.0.) THEN
00851       CALL T96MOD_TAILDISKADD(DMODIF,X,Y,Z,HXADD,HYADD,HZADD)
00852         BXT2ADD=WX+HXADD
00853         BYT2ADD=WY+HYADD
00854         BZT2ADD=WZ+HZADD
00855     ELSE
00856     BXT2ADD=0.
00857     BYT2ADD=0.
00858     BZT2ADD=0.
00859     ENDIF
00860 C
00861 
00862       CALL T96MOD_SHLCAR3X3(ATAIL3,X,Y,Z,SPS,WX,WY,WZ)
00863         CALL TAIL87(X,Z,HX,HZ)
00864         BXT3=WX+HX
00865         BYT3=WY
00866         BZT3=WZ+HZ
00867 C
00868         RETURN
00869         END
00870 C
00871 C********************************************************************
00872 C
00873         SUBROUTINE RINGCURR96(X,Y,Z,BX,BY,BZ)
00874 C
00875 C       THIS SUBROUTINE COMPUTES THE COMPONENTS OF THE RING CURRENT FIELD,
00876 C        SIMILAR TO THAT DESCRIBED BY TSYGANENKO AND PEREDO (1994).  THE
00877 C          DIFFERENCE IS THAT NOW WE USE SPACEWARPING, AS DESCRIBED IN THE
00878 C           PAPER ON MODELING BIRKELAND CURRENTS (TSYGANENKO AND STERN, 1996),
00879 C            INSTEAD OF SHEARING IT IN THE SPIRIT OF THE T89 TAIL MODEL.
00880 C
00881 C          IN  ADDITION, INSTEAD OF 7 TERMS FOR THE RING CURRENT MODEL, WE USE
00882 C             NOW ONLY 2 TERMS;  THIS SIMPLIFICATION ALSO GIVES RISE TO AN
00883 C                EASTWARD RING CURRENT LOCATED EARTHWARD FROM THE MAIN ONE,
00884 C                  IN LINE WITH WHAT IS ACTUALLY OBSERVED
00885 C
00886 C             FOR DETAILS, SEE NB #3, PAGES 70-73
00887 C
00888         IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00889         DIMENSION F(2),BETA(2)
00890         COMMON /WARP/ CPSS,SPSS,DPSRR, XNEXT(3),XS,ZSWARPED,DXSX,DXSY,
00891      *   DXSZ,DZSX,DZSYWARPED,DZSZ,OTHER(4),ZS  !  ZS HERE IS WITHOUT Y-Z WARP
00892 C
00893 
00894       DATA D0,DELTADX,XD,XLDX /2.,0.,0.,4./  !  ACHTUNG !!  THE RC IS NOW
00895 C                                            COMPLETELY SYMMETRIC (DELTADX=0)
00896 
00897 C
00898         DATA F,BETA /569.895366D0,-1603.386993D0,2.722188D0,3.766875D0/
00899 C
00900 C  THE ORIGINAL VALUES OF F(I) WERE MULTIPLIED BY BETA(I) (TO REDUCE THE
00901 C     NUMBER OF MULTIPLICATIONS BELOW)  AND BY THE FACTOR -0.43, NORMALIZING
00902 C      THE DISTURBANCE AT ORIGIN  TO  B=-1NT
00903 C
00904            DZSY=XS*Y*DPSRR  ! NO WARPING IN THE Y-Z PLANE (ALONG X ONLY), AND
00905 C                         THIS IS WHY WE DO NOT USE  DZSY FROM THE COMMON-BLOCK
00906            XXD=X-XD
00907            FDX=0.5D0*(1.D0+XXD/DSQRT(XXD**2+XLDX**2))
00908            DDDX=DELTADX*0.5D0*XLDX**2/DSQRT(XXD**2+XLDX**2)**3
00909            D=D0+DELTADX*FDX
00910 
00911            DZETAS=DSQRT(ZS**2+D**2)  !  THIS IS THE SAME SIMPLE WAY TO SPREAD
00912 C                                        OUT THE SHEET, AS THAT USED IN T89
00913            RHOS=DSQRT(XS**2+Y**2)
00914            DDZETADX=(ZS*DZSX+D*DDDX)/DZETAS
00915            DDZETADY=ZS*DZSY/DZETAS
00916            DDZETADZ=ZS*DZSZ/DZETAS
00917          IF (RHOS.LT.1.D-5) THEN
00918             DRHOSDX=0.D0
00919             DRHOSDY=DSIGN(1.D0,Y)
00920             DRHOSDZ=0.D0
00921           ELSE
00922            DRHOSDX=XS*DXSX/RHOS
00923            DRHOSDY=(XS*DXSY+Y)/RHOS
00924            DRHOSDZ=XS*DXSZ/RHOS
00925          ENDIF
00926 C
00927            BX=0.D0
00928            BY=0.D0
00929            BZ=0.D0
00930 C
00931            DO 1 I=1,2
00932 C
00933            BI=BETA(I)
00934 C
00935            S1=DSQRT((DZETAS+BI)**2+(RHOS+BI)**2)
00936            S2=DSQRT((DZETAS+BI)**2+(RHOS-BI)**2)
00937            DS1DDZ=(DZETAS+BI)/S1
00938            DS2DDZ=(DZETAS+BI)/S2
00939            DS1DRHOS=(RHOS+BI)/S1
00940            DS2DRHOS=(RHOS-BI)/S2
00941 C
00942            DS1DX=DS1DDZ*DDZETADX+DS1DRHOS*DRHOSDX
00943            DS1DY=DS1DDZ*DDZETADY+DS1DRHOS*DRHOSDY
00944            DS1DZ=DS1DDZ*DDZETADZ+DS1DRHOS*DRHOSDZ
00945 C
00946            DS2DX=DS2DDZ*DDZETADX+DS2DRHOS*DRHOSDX
00947            DS2DY=DS2DDZ*DDZETADY+DS2DRHOS*DRHOSDY
00948            DS2DZ=DS2DDZ*DDZETADZ+DS2DRHOS*DRHOSDZ
00949 C
00950            S1TS2=S1*S2
00951            S1PS2=S1+S2
00952            S1PS2SQ=S1PS2**2
00953            FAC1=DSQRT(S1PS2SQ-(2.D0*BI)**2)
00954            AS=FAC1/(S1TS2*S1PS2SQ)
00955            TERM1=1.D0/(S1TS2*S1PS2*FAC1)
00956            FAC2=AS/S1PS2SQ
00957            DASDS1=TERM1-FAC2/S1*(S2*S2+S1*(3.D0*S1+4.D0*S2))
00958            DASDS2=TERM1-FAC2/S2*(S1*S1+S2*(3.D0*S2+4.D0*S1))
00959 C
00960            DASDX=DASDS1*DS1DX+DASDS2*DS2DX
00961            DASDY=DASDS1*DS1DY+DASDS2*DS2DY
00962            DASDZ=DASDS1*DS1DZ+DASDS2*DS2DZ
00963 C
00964       BX=BX+F(I)*((2.D0*AS+Y*DASDY)*SPSS-XS*DASDZ
00965      *   +AS*DPSRR*(Y**2*CPSS+Z*ZS))
00966       BY=BY-F(I)*Y*(AS*DPSRR*XS+DASDZ*CPSS+DASDX*SPSS)
00967   1   BZ=BZ+F(I)*((2.D0*AS+Y*DASDY)*CPSS+XS*DASDX
00968      *   -AS*DPSRR*(X*ZS+Y**2*SPSS))
00969 C
00970        RETURN
00971        END
00972 C
00973 C$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$
00974 C
00975          SUBROUTINE T96MOD_TAILDISK(X,Y,Z,BX,BY,BZ)
00976 C
00977 C
00978 C       THIS SUBROUTINE COMPUTES THE COMPONENTS OF THE TAIL CURRENT FIELD,
00979 C        SIMILAR TO THAT DESCRIBED BY TSYGANENKO AND PEREDO (1994).  THE
00980 C          DIFFERENCE IS THAT NOW WE USE SPACEWARPING, AS DESCRIBED IN OUR
00981 C           PAPER ON MODELING BIRKELAND CURRENTS (TSYGANENKO AND STERN, 1996)
00982 C            INSTEAD OF SHEARING IT IN THE SPIRIT OF T89 TAIL MODEL.
00983 C
00984 C          IN  ADDITION, INSTEAD OF 8 TERMS FOR THE TAIL CURRENT MODEL, WE USE
00985 C           NOW ONLY 4 TERMS
00986 C
00987 C             FOR DETAILS, SEE NB #3, PAGES 74-
00988 C
00989          IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00990          DIMENSION F(4),BETA(4)
00991          COMMON /WARP/ CPSS,SPSS,DPSRR,XNEXT(3),XS,ZS,DXSX,DXSY,DXSZ,
00992      *    OTHER(3),DZETAS,DDZETADX,DDZETADY,DDZETADZ,ZSWW
00993 C
00994          DATA XSHIFT /4.5/
00995 C
00996          DATA F,BETA
00997      * / -745796.7338D0,1176470.141D0,-444610.529D0,-57508.01028D0,
00998      *   7.9250000D0,8.0850000D0,8.4712500D0,27.89500D0/
00999 C
01000 C  HERE ORIGINAL F(I) ARE MULTIPLIED BY BETA(I), TO ECONOMIZE
01001 C    CALCULATIONS
01002 C
01003            RHOS=DSQRT((XS-XSHIFT)**2+Y**2)
01004          IF (RHOS.LT.1.D-5) THEN
01005             DRHOSDX=0.D0
01006             DRHOSDY=DSIGN(1.D0,Y)
01007             DRHOSDZ=0.D0
01008          ELSE
01009            DRHOSDX=(XS-XSHIFT)*DXSX/RHOS
01010            DRHOSDY=((XS-XSHIFT)*DXSY+Y)/RHOS
01011            DRHOSDZ=(XS-XSHIFT)*DXSZ/RHOS
01012          ENDIF
01013 C
01014            BX=0.D0
01015            BY=0.D0
01016            BZ=0.D0
01017 C
01018            DO 1 I=1,4
01019 C
01020            BI=BETA(I)
01021 C
01022            S1=DSQRT((DZETAS+BI)**2+(RHOS+BI)**2)
01023            S2=DSQRT((DZETAS+BI)**2+(RHOS-BI)**2)
01024            DS1DDZ=(DZETAS+BI)/S1
01025            DS2DDZ=(DZETAS+BI)/S2
01026            DS1DRHOS=(RHOS+BI)/S1
01027            DS2DRHOS=(RHOS-BI)/S2
01028 C
01029            DS1DX=DS1DDZ*DDZETADX+DS1DRHOS*DRHOSDX
01030            DS1DY=DS1DDZ*DDZETADY+DS1DRHOS*DRHOSDY
01031            DS1DZ=DS1DDZ*DDZETADZ+DS1DRHOS*DRHOSDZ
01032 C
01033            DS2DX=DS2DDZ*DDZETADX+DS2DRHOS*DRHOSDX
01034            DS2DY=DS2DDZ*DDZETADY+DS2DRHOS*DRHOSDY
01035            DS2DZ=DS2DDZ*DDZETADZ+DS2DRHOS*DRHOSDZ
01036 C
01037            S1TS2=S1*S2
01038            S1PS2=S1+S2
01039            S1PS2SQ=S1PS2**2
01040            FAC1=DSQRT(S1PS2SQ-(2.D0*BI)**2)
01041            AS=FAC1/(S1TS2*S1PS2SQ)
01042            TERM1=1.D0/(S1TS2*S1PS2*FAC1)
01043            FAC2=AS/S1PS2SQ
01044            DASDS1=TERM1-FAC2/S1*(S2*S2+S1*(3.D0*S1+4.D0*S2))
01045            DASDS2=TERM1-FAC2/S2*(S1*S1+S2*(3.D0*S2+4.D0*S1))
01046 C
01047            DASDX=DASDS1*DS1DX+DASDS2*DS2DX
01048            DASDY=DASDS1*DS1DY+DASDS2*DS2DY
01049            DASDZ=DASDS1*DS1DZ+DASDS2*DS2DZ
01050 C
01051       BX=BX+F(I)*((2.D0*AS+Y*DASDY)*SPSS-(XS-XSHIFT)*DASDZ
01052      *   +AS*DPSRR*(Y**2*CPSS+Z*ZSWW))
01053 C
01054       BY=BY-F(I)*Y*(AS*DPSRR*XS+DASDZ*CPSS+DASDX*SPSS)
01055   1   BZ=BZ+F(I)*((2.D0*AS+Y*DASDY)*CPSS+(XS-XSHIFT)*DASDX
01056      *   -AS*DPSRR*(X*ZSWW+Y**2*SPSS))
01057 
01058        RETURN
01059        END
01060 
01061 C-------------------------------------------------------------------------
01062 C$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$
01063 C
01064          SUBROUTINE T96MOD_TAILDISKADD(DMODIF,X,Y,Z,BX,BY,BZ)
01065 C
01066 C       THE SAME AS ABOVE BUT FOR DIFFERENT D!
01067 C
01068 C
01069          IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01070          DIMENSION F(4),BETA(4)
01071          COMMON /WARP/ CPSS,SPSS,DPSRR,XNEXT(3),XS,ZS,DXSX,DXSY,DXSZ,
01072      *    DZSX,DZSY,DZSZ,DZETAS1,DDZETADX1,DDZETADY1,DDZETADZ1,ZSWW
01073 C
01074          DATA XSHIFT /4.5/
01075        DATA DELTADY /10./
01076 C
01077          DATA F,BETA
01078      * / -745796.7338D0,1176470.141D0,-444610.529D0,-57508.01028D0,
01079      *   7.9250000D0,8.0850000D0,8.4712500D0,27.89500D0/
01080 C
01081 C  HERE ORIGINAL F(I) ARE MULTIPLIED BY BETA(I), TO ECONOMIZE
01082 C    CALCULATIONS
01083 C
01084 
01085 
01086 C      HERE WE RECALCULATE SOME QUANTITIES FOR THIN CURRENT SHEET!!!!
01087 C        THEY ARE:D,DDDY,DZETAS,DDZETADX,DZETADY,DDZETADZ
01088 C        IN COMMON BLOCK WE RENAME THE CORRESPONDING VALUES NOT TO VARY THEM!
01089 
01090 
01091       D=DMODIF+DELTADY*(Y/20.D0)**2   ! SHEET HALF-THICKNESS FOR THE TAIL MODES
01092         DDDY=DELTADY*Y*0.005D0      !  (THICKENS TO FLANKS, BUT NO VARIATION
01093 C                                         ALONG X, IN CONTRAST TO RING CURRENT)
01094 C
01095         DZETAS=DSQRT(ZS**2+D**2)  !  THIS IS THE SAME SIMPLE WAY TO SPREAD
01096 C                                        OUT THE SHEET, AS THAT USED IN T89
01097         DDZETADX=ZS*DZSX/DZETAS
01098         DDZETADY=(ZS*DZSY+D*DDDY)/DZETAS
01099         DDZETADZ=ZS*DZSZ/DZETAS
01100 
01101 C     END OF INCLUSION!!!!
01102 
01103          RHOS=DSQRT((XS-XSHIFT)**2+Y**2)
01104          IF (RHOS.LT.1.D-5) THEN
01105             DRHOSDX=0.D0
01106             DRHOSDY=DSIGN(1.D0,Y)
01107             DRHOSDZ=0.D0
01108          ELSE
01109            DRHOSDX=(XS-XSHIFT)*DXSX/RHOS
01110            DRHOSDY=((XS-XSHIFT)*DXSY+Y)/RHOS
01111            DRHOSDZ=(XS-XSHIFT)*DXSZ/RHOS
01112          ENDIF
01113 C
01114            BX=0.D0
01115            BY=0.D0
01116            BZ=0.D0
01117 C
01118            DO 1 I=1,4
01119 C
01120            BI=BETA(I)
01121 C
01122            S1=DSQRT((DZETAS+BI)**2+(RHOS+BI)**2)
01123            S2=DSQRT((DZETAS+BI)**2+(RHOS-BI)**2)
01124            DS1DDZ=(DZETAS+BI)/S1
01125            DS2DDZ=(DZETAS+BI)/S2
01126            DS1DRHOS=(RHOS+BI)/S1
01127            DS2DRHOS=(RHOS-BI)/S2
01128 C
01129            DS1DX=DS1DDZ*DDZETADX+DS1DRHOS*DRHOSDX
01130            DS1DY=DS1DDZ*DDZETADY+DS1DRHOS*DRHOSDY
01131            DS1DZ=DS1DDZ*DDZETADZ+DS1DRHOS*DRHOSDZ
01132 C
01133            DS2DX=DS2DDZ*DDZETADX+DS2DRHOS*DRHOSDX
01134            DS2DY=DS2DDZ*DDZETADY+DS2DRHOS*DRHOSDY
01135            DS2DZ=DS2DDZ*DDZETADZ+DS2DRHOS*DRHOSDZ
01136 C
01137            S1TS2=S1*S2
01138            S1PS2=S1+S2
01139            S1PS2SQ=S1PS2**2
01140            FAC1=DSQRT(S1PS2SQ-(2.D0*BI)**2)
01141            AS=FAC1/(S1TS2*S1PS2SQ)
01142            TERM1=1.D0/(S1TS2*S1PS2*FAC1)
01143            FAC2=AS/S1PS2SQ
01144            DASDS1=TERM1-FAC2/S1*(S2*S2+S1*(3.D0*S1+4.D0*S2))
01145            DASDS2=TERM1-FAC2/S2*(S1*S1+S2*(3.D0*S2+4.D0*S1))
01146 C
01147            DASDX=DASDS1*DS1DX+DASDS2*DS2DX
01148            DASDY=DASDS1*DS1DY+DASDS2*DS2DY
01149            DASDZ=DASDS1*DS1DZ+DASDS2*DS2DZ
01150 C
01151       BX=BX+F(I)*((2.D0*AS+Y*DASDY)*SPSS-(XS-XSHIFT)*DASDZ
01152      *   +AS*DPSRR*(Y**2*CPSS+Z*ZSWW))
01153 C
01154       BY=BY-F(I)*Y*(AS*DPSRR*XS+DASDZ*CPSS+DASDX*SPSS)
01155   1   BZ=BZ+F(I)*((2.D0*AS+Y*DASDY)*CPSS+(XS-XSHIFT)*DASDX
01156      *   -AS*DPSRR*(X*ZSWW+Y**2*SPSS))
01157 
01158        RETURN
01159        END
01160 
01161 C---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01162 C&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&
01163 
01164       SUBROUTINE TAIL87(X,Z,BX,BZ)
01165 
01166       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01167 
01168       COMMON /WARP/ FIRST(3), RPS,WARP,D, OTHER(13)
01169 C
01170 C      'LONG' VERSION OF THE 1987 TAIL MAGNETIC FIELD MODEL
01171 C              (N.A.TSYGANENKO, PLANET. SPACE SCI., V.35, P.1347, 1987)
01172 C
01173 C      D   IS THE Y-DEPENDENT SHEET HALF-THICKNESS (INCREASING TOWARDS FLANKS)
01174 C      RPS  IS THE TILT-DEPENDENT SHIFT OF THE SHEET IN THE Z-DIRECTION,
01175 C           CORRESPONDING TO THE ASYMPTOTIC HINGING DISTANCE, DEFINED IN THE
01176 C           MAIN SUBROUTINE (TAILRC96) FROM THE PARAMETERS RH AND DR OF THE
01177 C           T96-TYPE MODULE, AND
01178 C      WARP  IS THE BENDING OF THE SHEET FLANKS IN THE Z-DIRECTION, DIRECTED
01179 C           OPPOSITE TO RPS, AND INCREASING WITH DIPOLE TILT AND |Y|
01180 C
01181 
01182         DATA DD/3./
01183 C
01184       DATA HPI,RT,XN,X1,X2,B0,B1,B2,XN21,XNR,ADLN
01185      * /1.5707963,40.,-10.,
01186      * -1.261,-0.663,0.391734,5.89715,24.6833,76.37,-0.1071,0.13238005/
01187 C                !!!   THESE ARE NEW VALUES OF  X1, X2, B0, B1, B2,
01188 C                       CORRESPONDING TO TSCALE=1, INSTEAD OF TSCALE=0.6
01189 C
01190 C  THE ABOVE QUANTITIES WERE DEFINED AS FOLLOWS:------------------------
01191 C       HPI=PI/2
01192 C       RT=40.      !  Z-POSITION OF UPPER AND LOWER ADDITIONAL SHEETS
01193 C       XN=-10.     !  INNER EDGE POSITION
01194 C
01195 C       TSCALE=1  !  SCALING FACTOR, DEFINING THE RATE OF INCREASE OF THE
01196 C                       CURRENT DENSITY TAILWARDS
01197 C
01198 C  ATTENTION !  NOW I HAVE CHANGED TSCALE TO:  TSCALE=1.0, INSTEAD OF 0.6
01199 C                  OF THE PREVIOUS VERSION
01200 C
01201 C       B0=0.391734
01202 C       B1=5.89715 *TSCALE
01203 C       B2=24.6833 *TSCALE**2
01204 C
01205 C    HERE ORIGINAL VALUES OF THE MODE AMPLITUDES (P.77, NB#3) WERE NORMALIZED
01206 C      SO THAT ASYMPTOTIC  BX=1  AT X=-200RE
01207 C
01208 C      X1=(4.589  -5.85) *TSCALE -(TSCALE-1.)*XN ! NONLINEAR PARAMETERS OF THE
01209 C                                                         CURRENT FUNCTION
01210 C      X2=(5.187  -5.85) *TSCALE -(TSCALE-1.)*XN
01211 C
01212 C
01213 C      XN21=(XN-X1)**2
01214 C      XNR=1./(XN-X2)
01215 C      ADLN=-DLOG(XNR**2*XN21)
01216 C
01217 C---------------------------------------------------------------
01218 C
01219       ZS=Z -RPS +WARP
01220       ZP=Z-RT
01221       ZM=Z+RT
01222 C
01223       XNX=XN-X
01224       XNX2=XNX**2
01225       XC1=X-X1
01226       XC2=X-X2
01227       XC22=XC2**2
01228       XR2=XC2*XNR
01229       XC12=XC1**2
01230       D2=DD**2    !  SQUARE OF THE TOTAL HALFTHICKNESS (DD=3RE FOR THIS MODE)
01231       B20=ZS**2+D2
01232       B2P=ZP**2+D2
01233       B2M=ZM**2+D2
01234       B=DSQRT(B20)
01235       BP=DSQRT(B2P)
01236       BM=DSQRT(B2M)
01237       XA1=XC12+B20
01238       XAP1=XC12+B2P
01239       XAM1=XC12+B2M
01240       XA2=1./(XC22+B20)
01241       XAP2=1./(XC22+B2P)
01242       XAM2=1./(XC22+B2M)
01243       XNA=XNX2+B20
01244       XNAP=XNX2+B2P
01245       XNAM=XNX2+B2M
01246       F=B20-XC22
01247       FP=B2P-XC22
01248       FM=B2M-XC22
01249       XLN1=DLOG(XN21/XNA)
01250       XLNP1=DLOG(XN21/XNAP)
01251       XLNM1=DLOG(XN21/XNAM)
01252       XLN2=XLN1+ADLN
01253       XLNP2=XLNP1+ADLN
01254       XLNM2=XLNM1+ADLN
01255       ALN=0.25*(XLNP1+XLNM1-2.*XLN1)
01256       S0=(DATAN(XNX/B)+HPI)/B
01257       S0P=(DATAN(XNX/BP)+HPI)/BP
01258       S0M=(DATAN(XNX/BM)+HPI)/BM
01259       S1=(XLN1*.5+XC1*S0)/XA1
01260       S1P=(XLNP1*.5+XC1*S0P)/XAP1
01261       S1M=(XLNM1*.5+XC1*S0M)/XAM1
01262       S2=(XC2*XA2*XLN2-XNR-F*XA2*S0)*XA2
01263       S2P=(XC2*XAP2*XLNP2-XNR-FP*XAP2*S0P)*XAP2
01264       S2M=(XC2*XAM2*XLNM2-XNR-FM*XAM2*S0M)*XAM2
01265       G1=(B20*S0-0.5*XC1*XLN1)/XA1
01266       G1P=(B2P*S0P-0.5*XC1*XLNP1)/XAP1
01267       G1M=(B2M*S0M-0.5*XC1*XLNM1)/XAM1
01268       G2=((0.5*F*XLN2+2.*S0*B20*XC2)*XA2+XR2)*XA2
01269       G2P=((0.5*FP*XLNP2+2.*S0P*B2P*XC2)*XAP2+XR2)*XAP2
01270       G2M=((0.5*FM*XLNM2+2.*S0M*B2M*XC2)*XAM2+XR2)*XAM2
01271       BX=B0*(ZS*S0-0.5*(ZP*S0P+ZM*S0M))
01272      * +B1*(ZS*S1-0.5*(ZP*S1P+ZM*S1M))+B2*(ZS*S2-0.5*(ZP*S2P+ZM*S2M))
01273       BZ=B0*ALN+B1*(G1-0.5*(G1P+G1M))+B2*(G2-0.5*(G2P+G2M))
01274 C
01275 C    CALCULATION OF THE MAGNETOTAIL CURRENT CONTRIBUTION IS FINISHED
01276 C
01277       RETURN
01278       END
01279 
01280 C$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$
01281 C
01282 C THIS CODE RETURNS THE SHIELDING FIELD REPRESENTED BY  2X3X3=18 "CARTESIAN"
01283 C    HARMONICS
01284 C
01285          SUBROUTINE  T96MOD_SHLCAR3X3(A,X,Y,Z,SPS,HX,HY,HZ)
01286 C
01287 C - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
01288 C  THE 36 COEFFICIENTS ENTER IN PAIRS IN THE AMPLITUDES OF THE "CARTESIAN"
01289 C    HARMONICS (A(1)-A(36).
01290 C  THE 12 NONLINEAR PARAMETERS (A(37)-A(48) ARE THE SCALES PI,RI,QI,AND SI
01291 C   ENTERING THE ARGUMENTS OF EXPONENTS, SINES, AND COSINES IN EACH OF THE
01292 C   18 "CARTESIAN" HARMONICS
01293 C - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
01294 C
01295      IMPLICIT  REAL * 8  (A - H, O - Z)
01296 C
01297          DIMENSION A(48)
01298 C
01299           CPS=DSQRT(1.D0-SPS**2)
01300           S3PS=4.D0*CPS**2-1.D0   !  THIS IS SIN(3*PS)/SIN(PS)
01301 C
01302            HX=0.D0
01303            HY=0.D0
01304            HZ=0.D0
01305            L=0
01306 C
01307            DO 1 M=1,2     !    M=1 IS FOR THE 1ST SUM ("PERP." SYMMETRY)
01308 C                           AND M=2 IS FOR THE SECOND SUM ("PARALL." SYMMETRY)
01309              DO 2 I=1,3
01310                   P=A(36+I)
01311                   Q=A(42+I)
01312                   CYPI=DCOS(Y/P)
01313                   CYQI=DCOS(Y/Q)
01314                   SYPI=DSIN(Y/P)
01315                   SYQI=DSIN(Y/Q)
01316 C
01317               DO 3 K=1,3
01318                    R=A(39+K)
01319                    S=A(45+K)
01320                    SZRK=DSIN(Z/R)
01321                    CZSK=DCOS(Z/S)
01322                    CZRK=DCOS(Z/R)
01323                    SZSK=DSIN(Z/S)
01324                      SQPR=DSQRT(1.D0/P**2+1.D0/R**2)
01325                      SQQS=DSQRT(1.D0/Q**2+1.D0/S**2)
01326                         EPR=DEXP(X*SQPR)
01327                         EQS=DEXP(X*SQQS)
01328 C
01329                    DO 4 N=1,2  ! N=1 IS FOR THE FIRST PART OF EACH COEFFICIENT
01330 C                                  AND N=2 IS FOR THE SECOND ONE
01331 C
01332                     L=L+1
01333                      IF (M.EQ.1) THEN
01334                        IF (N.EQ.1) THEN
01335                          DX=-SQPR*EPR*CYPI*SZRK
01336                          DY=EPR/P*SYPI*SZRK
01337                          DZ=-EPR/R*CYPI*CZRK
01338                          HX=HX+A(L)*DX
01339                          HY=HY+A(L)*DY
01340                          HZ=HZ+A(L)*DZ
01341                                    ELSE
01342                          DX=DX*CPS
01343                          DY=DY*CPS
01344                          DZ=DZ*CPS
01345                          HX=HX+A(L)*DX
01346                          HY=HY+A(L)*DY
01347                          HZ=HZ+A(L)*DZ
01348                                    ENDIF
01349                      ELSE
01350                        IF (N.EQ.1) THEN
01351                          DX=-SPS*SQQS*EQS*CYQI*CZSK
01352                          DY=SPS*EQS/Q*SYQI*CZSK
01353                          DZ=SPS*EQS/S*CYQI*SZSK
01354                          HX=HX+A(L)*DX
01355                          HY=HY+A(L)*DY
01356                          HZ=HZ+A(L)*DZ
01357                                    ELSE
01358                          DX=DX*S3PS
01359                          DY=DY*S3PS
01360                          DZ=DZ*S3PS
01361                          HX=HX+A(L)*DX
01362                          HY=HY+A(L)*DY
01363                          HZ=HZ+A(L)*DZ
01364                        ENDIF
01365                  ENDIF
01366 C
01367   4   CONTINUE
01368   3   CONTINUE
01369   2   CONTINUE
01370   1   CONTINUE
01371 C
01372          RETURN
01373      END
01374 
01375 C
01376 C@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
01377 C
01378        SUBROUTINE BIRK1TOT_02(PS,X,Y,Z,BX,BY,BZ)
01379 C
01380 C  THIS IS THE SECOND VERSION OF THE ANALYTICAL MODEL OF THE REGION 1 FIELD
01381 C   BASED ON A SEPARATE REPRESENTATION OF THE POTENTIAL FIELD IN THE INNER AND
01382 C   OUTER SPACE, MAPPED BY MEANS OF A SPHERO-DIPOLAR COORDINATE SYSTEM (NB #3,
01383 C   P.91).   THE DIFFERENCE FROM THE FIRST ONE IS THAT INSTEAD OF OCTAGONAL
01384 C   CURRENT LOOPS, CIRCULAR ONES ARE USED IN THIS VERSION FOR APPROXIMATING THE
01385 C   FIELD IN THE OUTER REGION, WHICH IS FASTER.
01386 C
01387       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01388 C
01389       DIMENSION D1(3,26),D2(3,79),XI(4),C1(26),C2(79)
01390 
01391          COMMON /COORD11/ XX1(12),YY1(12)
01392          COMMON /RHDR/ RH,DR
01393          COMMON /LOOPDIP1/ TILT,XCENTRE(2),RADIUS(2), DIPX,DIPY
01394 C
01395          COMMON /COORD21/ XX2(14),YY2(14),ZZ2(14)
01396          COMMON /DX1/ DX,SCALEIN,SCALEOUT
01397 C
01398       DATA C1/-0.911582E-03,-0.376654E-02,-0.727423E-02,-0.270084E-02,
01399      * -0.123899E-02,-0.154387E-02,-0.340040E-02,-0.191858E-01,
01400      * -0.518979E-01,0.635061E-01,0.440680,-0.396570,0.561238E-02,
01401      *  0.160938E-02,-0.451229E-02,-0.251810E-02,-0.151599E-02,
01402      * -0.133665E-02,-0.962089E-03,-0.272085E-01,-0.524319E-01,
01403      *  0.717024E-01,0.523439,-0.405015,-89.5587,23.2806/
01404 
01405 C
01406       DATA C2/6.04133,.305415,.606066E-02,.128379E-03,-.179406E-04,
01407      * 1.41714,-27.2586,-4.28833,-1.30675,35.5607,8.95792,.961617E-03,
01408      * -.801477E-03,-.782795E-03,-1.65242,-16.5242,-5.33798,.424878E-03,
01409      * .331787E-03,-.704305E-03,.844342E-03,.953682E-04,.886271E-03,
01410      * 25.1120,20.9299,5.14569,-44.1670,-51.0672,-1.87725,20.2998,
01411      * 48.7505,-2.97415,3.35184,-54.2921,-.838712,-10.5123,70.7594,
01412      * -4.94104,.106166E-03,.465791E-03,-.193719E-03,10.8439,-29.7968,
01413      *  8.08068,.463507E-03,-.224475E-04,.177035E-03,-.317581E-03,
01414      * -.264487E-03,.102075E-03,7.71390,10.1915,-4.99797,-23.1114,
01415      *-29.2043,12.2928,10.9542,33.6671,-9.3851,.174615E-03,-.789777E-06,
01416      * .686047E-03,.460104E-04,-.345216E-02,.221871E-02,.110078E-01,
01417      * -.661373E-02,.249201E-02,.343978E-01,-.193145E-05,.493963E-05,
01418      * -.535748E-04,.191833E-04,-.100496E-03,-.210103E-03,-.232195E-02,
01419      * .315335E-02,-.134320E-01,-.263222E-01/
01420 C
01421       DATA TILT,XCENTRE,RADIUS,DIPX,DIPY /1.00891,2.28397,-5.60831,
01422      * 1.86106,7.83281,1.12541,0.945719/
01423 
01424       DATA DX,SCALEIN,SCALEOUT /-0.16D0,0.08D0,0.4D0/
01425       DATA XX1/-11.D0,2*-7.D0,2*-3.D0,3*1.D0,2*5.D0,2*9.D0/
01426       DATA YY1/2.D0,0.D0,4.D0,2.D0,6.D0,0.D0,4.D0,8.D0,2.D0,6.D0,0.D0,
01427      *  4.D0/
01428       DATA XX2/-10.D0,-7.D0,2*-4.D0,0.D0,2*4.D0,7.D0,10.D0,5*0.D0/
01429       DATA YY2/3.D0,6.D0,3.D0,9.D0,6.D0,3.D0,9.D0,6.D0,3.D0,5*0.D0/
01430       DATA ZZ2/2*20.D0,4.D0,20.D0,2*4.D0,3*20.D0,2.D0,3.D0,4.5D0,
01431      *  7.D0,10.D0/
01432 C
01433       DATA RH,DR /9.D0,4.D0/   !  RH IS THE "HINGING DISTANCE" AND DR IS THE
01434 C                                TRANSITION SCALE LENGTH, DEFINING THE
01435 C                                CURVATURE  OF THE WARPING (SEE P.89, NB #2)
01436 C
01437       DATA XLTDAY,XLTNGHT /78.D0,70.D0/  !  THESE ARE LATITUDES OF THE R-1 OVAL
01438 C                                             AT NOON AND AT MIDNIGHT
01439       DATA DTET0 /0.034906/   !   THIS IS THE LATITUDINAL HALF-THICKNESS OF THE
01440 C                                  R-1 OVAL (THE INTERPOLATION REGION BETWEEN
01441 C                                    THE HIGH-LAT. AND THE PLASMA SHEET)
01442 C
01443         TNOONN=(90.D0-XLTDAY)*0.01745329D0
01444         TNOONS=3.141592654D0-TNOONN     ! HERE WE ASSUME THAT THE POSITIONS OF
01445 C                                          THE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN R-1 OVALS
01446 C                                          ARE SYMMETRIC IN THE SM-COORDINATES
01447         DTETDN=(XLTDAY-XLTNGHT)*0.01745329D0
01448         DR2=DR**2
01449 C
01450       SPS=DSIN(PS)
01451       R2=X**2+Y**2+Z**2
01452       R=DSQRT(R2)
01453       R3=R*R2
01454 C
01455       RMRH=R-RH
01456       RPRH=R+RH
01457       SQM=DSQRT(RMRH**2+DR2)
01458       SQP=DSQRT(RPRH**2+DR2)
01459       C=SQP-SQM
01460       Q=DSQRT((RH+1.D0)**2+DR2)-DSQRT((RH-1.D0)**2+DR2)
01461       SPSAS=SPS/R*C/Q
01462       CPSAS=DSQRT(1.D0-SPSAS**2)
01463        XAS = X*CPSAS-Z*SPSAS
01464        ZAS = X*SPSAS+Z*CPSAS
01465         IF (XAS.NE.0.D0.OR.Y.NE.0.D0) THEN
01466           PAS = DATAN2(Y,XAS)
01467                                       ELSE
01468           PAS=0.D0
01469         ENDIF
01470 C
01471       TAS=DATAN2(DSQRT(XAS**2+Y**2),ZAS)
01472       STAS=DSIN(TAS)
01473       F=STAS/(STAS**6*(1.D0-R3)+R3)**0.1666666667D0
01474 C
01475       TET0=DASIN(F)
01476       IF (TAS.GT.1.5707963D0) TET0=3.141592654D0-TET0
01477       DTET=DTETDN*DSIN(PAS*0.5D0)**2
01478       TETR1N=TNOONN+DTET
01479       TETR1S=TNOONS-DTET
01480 C
01481 C NOW LET'S DEFINE WHICH OF THE FOUR REGIONS (HIGH-LAT., NORTHERN PSBL,
01482 C   PLASMA SHEET, SOUTHERN PSBL) DOES THE POINT (X,Y,Z) BELONG TO:
01483 C
01484        IF (TET0.LT.TETR1N-DTET0.OR.TET0.GT.TETR1S+DTET0)  LOC=1 ! HIGH-LAT.
01485        IF (TET0.GT.TETR1N+DTET0.AND.TET0.LT.TETR1S-DTET0) LOC=2 ! PL.SHEET
01486        IF (TET0.GE.TETR1N-DTET0.AND.TET0.LE.TETR1N+DTET0) LOC=3 ! NORTH PSBL
01487        IF (TET0.GE.TETR1S-DTET0.AND.TET0.LE.TETR1S+DTET0) LOC=4 ! SOUTH PSBL
01488 C
01489        IF (LOC.EQ.1) THEN   ! IN THE HIGH-LAT. REGION USE THE SUBROUTINE DIPOCT
01490 C
01491 C      PRINT *, '  LOC=1 (HIGH-LAT)'    !  (TEST PRINTOUT; DISABLED NOW)
01492          XI(1)=X
01493          XI(2)=Y
01494          XI(3)=Z
01495          XI(4)=PS
01496          CALL  DIPLOOP1(XI,D1)
01497           BX=0.D0
01498           BY=0.D0
01499           BZ=0.D0
01500             DO 1 I=1,26
01501               BX=BX+C1(I)*D1(1,I)
01502               BY=BY+C1(I)*D1(2,I)
01503   1           BZ=BZ+C1(I)*D1(3,I)
01504        ENDIF                                           !  END OF THE CASE 1
01505 C
01506        IF (LOC.EQ.2) THEN
01507 C           PRINT *, '  LOC=2 (PLASMA SHEET)'  !  (TEST PRINTOUT; DISABLED NOW)
01508 C
01509          XI(1)=X
01510          XI(2)=Y
01511          XI(3)=Z
01512          XI(4)=PS
01513          CALL  CONDIP1(XI,D2)
01514           BX=0.D0
01515           BY=0.D0
01516           BZ=0.D0
01517             DO 2 I=1,79
01518               BX=BX+C2(I)*D2(1,I)
01519               BY=BY+C2(I)*D2(2,I)
01520   2           BZ=BZ+C2(I)*D2(3,I)
01521        ENDIF                                           !   END OF THE CASE 2
01522 C
01523        IF (LOC.EQ.3) THEN
01524 C       PRINT *, '  LOC=3 (NORTH PSBL)'  !  (TEST PRINTOUT; DISABLED NOW)
01525 C
01526          T01=TETR1N-DTET0
01527          T02=TETR1N+DTET0
01528           SQR=DSQRT(R)
01529           ST01AS=SQR/(R3+1.D0/DSIN(T01)**6-1.D0)**0.1666666667
01530           ST02AS=SQR/(R3+1.D0/DSIN(T02)**6-1.D0)**0.1666666667
01531           CT01AS=DSQRT(1.D0-ST01AS**2)
01532           CT02AS=DSQRT(1.D0-ST02AS**2)
01533          XAS1=R*ST01AS*DCOS(PAS)
01534          Y1=  R*ST01AS*DSIN(PAS)
01535          ZAS1=R*CT01AS
01536          X1=XAS1*CPSAS+ZAS1*SPSAS
01537          Z1=-XAS1*SPSAS+ZAS1*CPSAS ! X1,Y1,Z1 ARE COORDS OF THE NORTHERN
01538 C                                                      BOUNDARY POINT
01539          XI(1)=X1
01540          XI(2)=Y1
01541          XI(3)=Z1
01542          XI(4)=PS
01543          CALL  DIPLOOP1(XI,D1)
01544           BX1=0.D0
01545           BY1=0.D0
01546           BZ1=0.D0
01547             DO 11 I=1,26
01548               BX1=BX1+C1(I)*D1(1,I) !   BX1,BY1,BZ1  ARE FIELD COMPONENTS
01549               BY1=BY1+C1(I)*D1(2,I)  !  IN THE NORTHERN BOUNDARY POINT
01550  11           BZ1=BZ1+C1(I)*D1(3,I)  !
01551 C
01552          XAS2=R*ST02AS*DCOS(PAS)
01553          Y2=  R*ST02AS*DSIN(PAS)
01554          ZAS2=R*CT02AS
01555          X2=XAS2*CPSAS+ZAS2*SPSAS
01556          Z2=-XAS2*SPSAS+ZAS2*CPSAS ! X2,Y2,Z2 ARE COORDS OF THE SOUTHERN
01557 C                                        BOUNDARY POINT
01558          XI(1)=X2
01559          XI(2)=Y2
01560          XI(3)=Z2
01561          XI(4)=PS
01562          CALL  CONDIP1(XI,D2)
01563           BX2=0.D0
01564           BY2=0.D0
01565           BZ2=0.D0
01566             DO 12 I=1,79
01567               BX2=BX2+C2(I)*D2(1,I)!  BX2,BY2,BZ2  ARE FIELD COMPONENTS
01568               BY2=BY2+C2(I)*D2(2,I) !  IN THE SOUTHERN BOUNDARY POINT
01569   12          BZ2=BZ2+C2(I)*D2(3,I)
01570 C
01571 C  NOW INTERPOLATE:
01572 C
01573          SS=DSQRT((X2-X1)**2+(Y2-Y1)**2+(Z2-Z1)**2)
01574          DS=DSQRT((X-X1)**2+(Y-Y1)**2+(Z-Z1)**2)
01575          FRAC=DS/SS
01576          BX=BX1*(1.D0-FRAC)+BX2*FRAC
01577          BY=BY1*(1.D0-FRAC)+BY2*FRAC
01578          BZ=BZ1*(1.D0-FRAC)+BZ2*FRAC
01579 C
01580         ENDIF                                              ! END OF THE CASE 3
01581 C
01582         IF (LOC.EQ.4) THEN
01583 C       PRINT *, '  LOC=4 (SOUTH PSBL)'  !  (TEST PRINTOUT; DISABLED NOW)
01584 C
01585          T01=TETR1S-DTET0
01586          T02=TETR1S+DTET0
01587           SQR=DSQRT(R)
01588           ST01AS=SQR/(R3+1.D0/DSIN(T01)**6-1.D0)**0.1666666667
01589           ST02AS=SQR/(R3+1.D0/DSIN(T02)**6-1.D0)**0.1666666667
01590           CT01AS=-DSQRT(1.D0-ST01AS**2)
01591           CT02AS=-DSQRT(1.D0-ST02AS**2)
01592          XAS1=R*ST01AS*DCOS(PAS)
01593          Y1=  R*ST01AS*DSIN(PAS)
01594          ZAS1=R*CT01AS
01595          X1=XAS1*CPSAS+ZAS1*SPSAS
01596          Z1=-XAS1*SPSAS+ZAS1*CPSAS ! X1,Y1,Z1 ARE COORDS OF THE NORTHERN
01597 C                                               BOUNDARY POINT
01598          XI(1)=X1
01599          XI(2)=Y1
01600          XI(3)=Z1
01601          XI(4)=PS
01602          CALL  CONDIP1(XI,D2)
01603           BX1=0.D0
01604           BY1=0.D0
01605           BZ1=0.D0
01606             DO 21 I=1,79
01607               BX1=BX1+C2(I)*D2(1,I) !  BX1,BY1,BZ1  ARE FIELD COMPONENTS
01608               BY1=BY1+C2(I)*D2(2,I)  !  IN THE NORTHERN BOUNDARY POINT
01609  21           BZ1=BZ1+C2(I)*D2(3,I)  !
01610 C
01611          XAS2=R*ST02AS*DCOS(PAS)
01612          Y2=  R*ST02AS*DSIN(PAS)
01613          ZAS2=R*CT02AS
01614          X2=XAS2*CPSAS+ZAS2*SPSAS
01615          Z2=-XAS2*SPSAS+ZAS2*CPSAS ! X2,Y2,Z2 ARE COORDS OF THE SOUTHERN
01616 C                                          BOUNDARY POINT
01617          XI(1)=X2
01618          XI(2)=Y2
01619          XI(3)=Z2
01620          XI(4)=PS
01621          CALL  DIPLOOP1(XI,D1)
01622           BX2=0.D0
01623           BY2=0.D0
01624           BZ2=0.D0
01625             DO 22 I=1,26
01626               BX2=BX2+C1(I)*D1(1,I) !  BX2,BY2,BZ2  ARE FIELD COMPONENTS
01627               BY2=BY2+C1(I)*D1(2,I) !     IN THE SOUTHERN BOUNDARY POINT
01628   22          BZ2=BZ2+C1(I)*D1(3,I)
01629 C
01630 C  NOW INTERPOLATE:
01631 C
01632          SS=DSQRT((X2-X1)**2+(Y2-Y1)**2+(Z2-Z1)**2)
01633          DS=DSQRT((X-X1)**2+(Y-Y1)**2+(Z-Z1)**2)
01634          FRAC=DS/SS
01635          BX=BX1*(1.D0-FRAC)+BX2*FRAC
01636          BY=BY1*(1.D0-FRAC)+BY2*FRAC
01637          BZ=BZ1*(1.D0-FRAC)+BZ2*FRAC
01638 C
01639         ENDIF                                        ! END OF THE CASE 4
01640 C
01641 C   NOW, LET US ADD THE SHIELDING FIELD
01642 C
01643         CALL  BIRK1SHLD(PS,X,Y,Z,BSX,BSY,BSZ)
01644         BX=BX+BSX
01645         BY=BY+BSY
01646         BZ=BZ+BSZ
01647          RETURN
01648          END
01649 C
01650 C------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01651 C
01652 C
01653          SUBROUTINE  DIPLOOP1(XI,D)
01654 C
01655 C
01656 C      CALCULATES DEPENDENT MODEL VARIABLES AND THEIR DERIVA-
01657 C  TIVES FOR GIVEN INDEPENDENT VARIABLES AND MODEL PARAME-
01658 C  TERS.  SPECIFIES MODEL FUNCTIONS WITH FREE PARAMETERS WHICH
01659 C  MUST BE DETERMINED BY MEANS OF LEAST SQUARES FITS (RMS
01660 C  MINIMIZATION PROCEDURE).
01661 C
01662 C      DESCRIPTION OF PARAMETERS:
01663 C
01664 C  XI  - INPUT VECTOR CONTAINING INDEPENDENT VARIABLES;
01665 C  D   - OUTPUT DOUBLE PRECISION VECTOR CONTAINING
01666 C        CALCULATED VALUES FOR DERIVATIVES OF DEPENDENT
01667 C        VARIABLES WITH RESPECT TO LINEAR MODEL PARAMETERS;
01668 C
01669 C - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
01670 C
01671 C  THE  26 COEFFICIENTS ARE MOMENTS (Z- AND X-COMPONENTS) OF 12 DIPOLES PLACED
01672 C    INSIDE THE  R1-SHELL,  PLUS AMPLITUDES OF TWO OCTAGONAL DOUBLE LOOPS.  
01673 C     THE DIPOLES WITH NONZERO  YI APPEAR IN PAIRS WITH EQUAL MOMENTS.
01674 C                  (SEE THE NOTEBOOK #2, PP.102-103, FOR DETAILS)
01675 C - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
01676 C
01677          IMPLICIT  REAL * 8  (A - H, O - Z)
01678 C
01679          COMMON /COORD11/ XX(12),YY(12)
01680          COMMON /LOOPDIP1/ TILT,XCENTRE(2),RADIUS(2),  DIPX,DIPY
01681          COMMON /RHDR/RH,DR
01682          DIMENSION XI(4),D(3,26)
01683 C
01684            X = XI(1)
01685        Y = XI(2)
01686        Z = XI(3)
01687            PS= XI(4)
01688            SPS=DSIN(PS)
01689 C
01690          DO 1 I=1,12     
01691            R2=(XX(I)*DIPX)**2+(YY(I)*DIPY)**2
01692            R=DSQRT(R2)
01693              RMRH=R-RH
01694              RPRH=R+RH
01695              DR2=DR**2
01696              SQM=DSQRT(RMRH**2+DR2)
01697              SQP=DSQRT(RPRH**2+DR2)
01698              C=SQP-SQM
01699              Q=DSQRT((RH+1.D0)**2+DR2)-DSQRT((RH-1.D0)**2+DR2)
01700              SPSAS=SPS/R*C/Q
01701              CPSAS=DSQRT(1.D0-SPSAS**2)
01702          XD= (XX(I)*DIPX)*CPSAS
01703          YD= (YY(I)*DIPY)
01704          ZD=-(XX(I)*DIPX)*SPSAS
01705       CALL DIPXYZ(X-XD,Y-YD,Z-ZD,BX1X,BY1X,BZ1X,BX1Y,BY1Y,BZ1Y,
01706      *  BX1Z,BY1Z,BZ1Z)
01707         IF (DABS(YD).GT.1.D-10) THEN
01708       CALL DIPXYZ(X-XD,Y+YD,Z-ZD,BX2X,BY2X,BZ2X,BX2Y,BY2Y,BZ2Y,
01709      *  BX2Z,BY2Z,BZ2Z)
01710                                    ELSE
01711         BX2X=0.D0
01712         BY2X=0.D0
01713         BZ2X=0.D0
01714 C
01715         BX2Z=0.D0
01716         BY2Z=0.D0
01717         BZ2Z=0.D0
01718                                    ENDIF
01719 C
01720             D(1,I)=BX1Z+BX2Z
01721             D(2,I)=BY1Z+BY2Z
01722             D(3,I)=BZ1Z+BZ2Z
01723             D(1,I+12)=(BX1X+BX2X)*SPS
01724             D(2,I+12)=(BY1X+BY2X)*SPS
01725             D(3,I+12)=(BZ1X+BZ2X)*SPS
01726   1   CONTINUE
01727 C
01728            R2=(XCENTRE(1)+RADIUS(1))**2
01729            R=DSQRT(R2)
01730              RMRH=R-RH
01731              RPRH=R+RH
01732              DR2=DR**2
01733              SQM=DSQRT(RMRH**2+DR2)
01734              SQP=DSQRT(RPRH**2+DR2)
01735              C=SQP-SQM
01736              Q=DSQRT((RH+1.D0)**2+DR2)-DSQRT((RH-1.D0)**2+DR2)
01737              SPSAS=SPS/R*C/Q
01738              CPSAS=DSQRT(1.D0-SPSAS**2)
01739          XOCT1= X*CPSAS-Z*SPSAS
01740          YOCT1= Y
01741          ZOCT1= X*SPSAS+Z*CPSAS
01742 C
01743       CALL CROSSLP(XOCT1,YOCT1,ZOCT1,BXOCT1,BYOCT1,BZOCT1,XCENTRE(1),
01744      *        RADIUS(1),TILT)
01745             D(1,25)=BXOCT1*CPSAS+BZOCT1*SPSAS
01746             D(2,25)=BYOCT1
01747             D(3,25)=-BXOCT1*SPSAS+BZOCT1*CPSAS
01748 C
01749            R2=(RADIUS(2)-XCENTRE(2))**2
01750            R=DSQRT(R2)
01751              RMRH=R-RH
01752              RPRH=R+RH
01753              DR2=DR**2
01754              SQM=DSQRT(RMRH**2+DR2)
01755              SQP=DSQRT(RPRH**2+DR2)
01756              C=SQP-SQM
01757              Q=DSQRT((RH+1.D0)**2+DR2)-DSQRT((RH-1.D0)**2+DR2)
01758              SPSAS=SPS/R*C/Q
01759              CPSAS=DSQRT(1.D0-SPSAS**2)
01760          XOCT2= X*CPSAS-Z*SPSAS -XCENTRE(2)
01761          YOCT2= Y
01762          ZOCT2= X*SPSAS+Z*CPSAS
01763             CALL CIRCLE(XOCT2,YOCT2,ZOCT2,RADIUS(2),BX,BY,BZ)
01764             D(1,26) =  BX*CPSAS+BZ*SPSAS
01765             D(2,26) =  BY
01766             D(3,26) = -BX*SPSAS+BZ*CPSAS
01767 C
01768             RETURN
01769             END
01770 C-------------------------------------------------------------------------
01771 C
01772         SUBROUTINE CIRCLE(X,Y,Z,RL,BX,BY,BZ)
01773 C
01774 C  RETURNS COMPONENTS OF THE FIELD FROM A CIRCULAR CURRENT LOOP OF RADIUS RL
01775 C   USES THE SECOND (MORE ACCURATE) APPROXIMATION GIVEN IN ABRAMOWITZ & STEGUN
01776 
01777         IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01778         REAL*8 K
01779         DATA PI/3.141592654D0/
01780 C
01781         RHO2=X*X+Y*Y
01782         RHO=DSQRT(RHO2)
01783         R22=Z*Z+(RHO+RL)**2
01784         R2=DSQRT(R22)
01785         R12=R22-4.D0*RHO*RL
01786         R32=0.5D0*(R12+R22)
01787         XK2=1.D0-R12/R22
01788         XK2S=1.D0-XK2
01789         DL=DLOG(1.D0/XK2S)
01790         K=1.38629436112D0+XK2S*(0.09666344259D0+XK2S*(0.03590092383+
01791      *     XK2S*(0.03742563713+XK2S*0.01451196212))) +DL*
01792      *     (0.5D0+XK2S*(0.12498593597D0+XK2S*(0.06880248576D0+
01793      *     XK2S*(0.03328355346D0+XK2S*0.00441787012D0))))
01794         E=1.D0+XK2S*(0.44325141463D0+XK2S*(0.0626060122D0+XK2S*
01795      *      (0.04757383546D0+XK2S*0.01736506451D0))) +DL*
01796      *     XK2S*(0.2499836831D0+XK2S*(0.09200180037D0+XK2S*
01797      *       (0.04069697526D0+XK2S*0.00526449639D0)))
01798 
01799         IF (RHO.GT.1.D-6) THEN
01800            BRHO=Z/(RHO2*R2)*(R32/R12*E-K) !  THIS IS NOT EXACTLY THE B-RHO COM-
01801                            ELSE           !   PONENT - NOTE THE ADDITIONAL 
01802            BRHO=PI*RL/R2*(RL-RHO)/R12*Z/(R32-RHO2)  !      DIVISION BY RHO
01803         ENDIF
01804 
01805         BX=BRHO*X                     
01806         BY=BRHO*Y                      
01807         BZ=(K-E*(R32-2.D0*RL*RL)/R12)/R2
01808         RETURN
01809         END
01810 C-------------------------------------------------------------
01811 C
01812         SUBROUTINE CROSSLP(X,Y,Z,BX,BY,BZ,XC,RL,AL)
01813 C
01814 C   RETURNS FIELD COMPONENTS OF A PAIR OF LOOPS WITH A COMMON CENTER AND 
01815 C    DIAMETER,  COINCIDING WITH THE X AXIS. THE LOOPS ARE INCLINED TO THE
01816 C    EQUATORIAL PLANE BY THE ANGLE AL (RADIANS) AND SHIFTED IN THE POSITIVE
01817 C     X-DIRECTION BY THE DISTANCE  XC.
01818 C
01819         IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01820 C
01821             CAL=DCOS(AL)
01822             SAL=DSIN(AL)
01823 C
01824         Y1=Y*CAL-Z*SAL
01825         Z1=Y*SAL+Z*CAL
01826         Y2=Y*CAL+Z*SAL
01827         Z2=-Y*SAL+Z*CAL
01828         CALL CIRCLE(X-XC,Y1,Z1,RL,BX1,BY1,BZ1)
01829         CALL CIRCLE(X-XC,Y2,Z2,RL,BX2,BY2,BZ2)
01830         BX=BX1+BX2
01831         BY= (BY1+BY2)*CAL+(BZ1-BZ2)*SAL
01832         BZ=-(BY1-BY2)*SAL+(BZ1+BZ2)*CAL
01833 C
01834         RETURN
01835         END
01836 
01837 C*******************************************************************
01838 
01839        SUBROUTINE DIPXYZ(X,Y,Z,BXX,BYX,BZX,BXY,BYY,BZY,BXZ,BYZ,BZZ)
01840 C
01841 C       RETURNS THE FIELD COMPONENTS PRODUCED BY THREE DIPOLES, EACH
01842 C        HAVING M=ME AND ORIENTED PARALLEL TO X,Y, AND Z AXIS, RESP.
01843 C
01844       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01845 C
01846       X2=X**2
01847       Y2=Y**2
01848       Z2=Z**2
01849       R2=X2+Y2+Z2
01850 
01851       XMR5=30574.D0/(R2*R2*DSQRT(R2))
01852       XMR53=3.D0*XMR5
01853       BXX=XMR5*(3.D0*X2-R2)
01854       BYX=XMR53*X*Y
01855       BZX=XMR53*X*Z
01856 C
01857       BXY=BYX
01858       BYY=XMR5*(3.D0*Y2-R2)
01859       BZY=XMR53*Y*Z
01860 C
01861       BXZ=BZX
01862       BYZ=BZY
01863       BZZ=XMR5*(3.D0*Z2-R2)
01864 C
01865       RETURN
01866       END
01867 C
01868 C------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01869          SUBROUTINE  CONDIP1(XI,D)
01870 C
01871 C      CALCULATES DEPENDENT MODEL VARIABLES AND THEIR DERIVATIVES FOR GIVEN
01872 C  INDEPENDENT VARIABLES AND MODEL PARAMETERS.  SPECIFIES MODEL FUNCTIONS WITH
01873 C  FREE PARAMETERS WHICH MUST BE DETERMINED BY MEANS OF LEAST SQUARES FITS
01874 C  (RMS MINIMIZATION PROCEDURE).
01875 C
01876 C      DESCRIPTION OF PARAMETERS:
01877 C
01878 C  XI  - INPUT VECTOR CONTAINING INDEPENDENT VARIABLES;
01879 C  D   - OUTPUT DOUBLE PRECISION VECTOR CONTAINING
01880 C        CALCULATED VALUES FOR DERIVATIVES OF DEPENDENT
01881 C        VARIABLES WITH RESPECT TO LINEAR MODEL PARAMETERS;
01882 C
01883 C - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
01884 C
01885 C  THE  79 COEFFICIENTS ARE (1) 5 AMPLITUDES OF THE CONICAL HARMONICS, PLUS
01886 C                           (2) (9X3+5X2)X2=74 COMPONENTS OF THE DIPOLE MOMENTS
01887 C              (SEE THE NOTEBOOK #2, PP.113-..., FOR DETAILS)
01888 C - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
01889 C
01890          IMPLICIT  REAL * 8  (A - H, O - Z)
01891 C
01892       COMMON /DX1/ DX,SCALEIN,SCALEOUT
01893       COMMON /COORD21/ XX(14),YY(14),ZZ(14)
01894 C
01895          DIMENSION XI(4),D(3,79),CF(5),SF(5)
01896 C
01897            X = XI(1)
01898        Y = XI(2)
01899        Z = XI(3)
01900            PS= XI(4)
01901            SPS=DSIN(PS)
01902            CPS=DCOS(PS)
01903 C
01904       XSM=X*CPS-Z*SPS  - DX
01905       ZSM=Z*CPS+X*SPS
01906       RO2=XSM**2+Y**2
01907       RO=SQRT(RO2)
01908 C
01909       CF(1)=XSM/RO
01910       SF(1)=Y/RO
01911 C
01912       CF(2)=CF(1)**2-SF(1)**2
01913       SF(2)=2.*SF(1)*CF(1)
01914       CF(3)=CF(2)*CF(1)-SF(2)*SF(1)
01915       SF(3)=SF(2)*CF(1)+CF(2)*SF(1)
01916       CF(4)=CF(3)*CF(1)-SF(3)*SF(1)
01917       SF(4)=SF(3)*CF(1)+CF(3)*SF(1)
01918       CF(5)=CF(4)*CF(1)-SF(4)*SF(1)
01919       SF(5)=SF(4)*CF(1)+CF(4)*SF(1)
01920 C
01921       R2=RO2+ZSM**2
01922       R=DSQRT(R2)
01923       C=ZSM/R
01924       S=RO/R
01925       CH=DSQRT(0.5D0*(1.D0+C))
01926       SH=DSQRT(0.5D0*(1.D0-C))
01927       TNH=SH/CH
01928       CNH=1.D0/TNH
01929 C
01930       DO 1 M=1,5
01931        BT=M*CF(M)/(R*S)*(TNH**M+CNH**M)
01932        BF=-0.5D0*M*SF(M)/R*(TNH**(M-1)/CH**2-CNH**(M-1)/SH**2)
01933        BXSM=BT*C*CF(1)-BF*SF(1)
01934        BY=BT*C*SF(1)+BF*CF(1)
01935        BZSM=-BT*S
01936 C
01937        D(1,M)=BXSM*CPS+BZSM*SPS
01938        D(2,M)=BY
01939   1    D(3,M)=-BXSM*SPS+BZSM*CPS
01940 C
01941       XSM = X*CPS-Z*SPS
01942       ZSM = Z*CPS+X*SPS
01943 C
01944         DO 2 I=1,9
01945 C
01946         IF (I.EQ.3.OR.I.EQ.5.OR.I.EQ.6) THEN
01947                 XD =  XX(I)*SCALEIN
01948                 YD =  YY(I)*SCALEIN
01949                                          ELSE
01950                 XD =  XX(I)*SCALEOUT
01951                 YD =  YY(I)*SCALEOUT
01952         ENDIF
01953 C
01954          ZD =  ZZ(I)
01955 C
01956       CALL DIPXYZ(XSM-XD,Y-YD,ZSM-ZD,BX1X,BY1X,BZ1X,BX1Y,BY1Y,BZ1Y,
01957      *  BX1Z,BY1Z,BZ1Z)
01958       CALL DIPXYZ(XSM-XD,Y+YD,ZSM-ZD,BX2X,BY2X,BZ2X,BX2Y,BY2Y,BZ2Y,
01959      *  BX2Z,BY2Z,BZ2Z)
01960       CALL DIPXYZ(XSM-XD,Y-YD,ZSM+ZD,BX3X,BY3X,BZ3X,BX3Y,BY3Y,BZ3Y,
01961      *  BX3Z,BY3Z,BZ3Z)
01962       CALL DIPXYZ(XSM-XD,Y+YD,ZSM+ZD,BX4X,BY4X,BZ4X,BX4Y,BY4Y,BZ4Y,
01963      *  BX4Z,BY4Z,BZ4Z)
01964 C
01965       IX=I*3+3
01966       IY=IX+1
01967       IZ=IY+1
01968 C
01969       D(1,IX)=(BX1X+BX2X-BX3X-BX4X)*CPS+(BZ1X+BZ2X-BZ3X-BZ4X)*SPS
01970       D(2,IX)= BY1X+BY2X-BY3X-BY4X
01971       D(3,IX)=(BZ1X+BZ2X-BZ3X-BZ4X)*CPS-(BX1X+BX2X-BX3X-BX4X)*SPS
01972 C
01973       D(1,IY)=(BX1Y-BX2Y-BX3Y+BX4Y)*CPS+(BZ1Y-BZ2Y-BZ3Y+BZ4Y)*SPS
01974       D(2,IY)= BY1Y-BY2Y-BY3Y+BY4Y
01975       D(3,IY)=(BZ1Y-BZ2Y-BZ3Y+BZ4Y)*CPS-(BX1Y-BX2Y-BX3Y+BX4Y)*SPS
01976 C
01977       D(1,IZ)=(BX1Z+BX2Z+BX3Z+BX4Z)*CPS+(BZ1Z+BZ2Z+BZ3Z+BZ4Z)*SPS
01978       D(2,IZ)= BY1Z+BY2Z+BY3Z+BY4Z
01979       D(3,IZ)=(BZ1Z+BZ2Z+BZ3Z+BZ4Z)*CPS-(BX1Z+BX2Z+BX3Z+BX4Z)*SPS
01980 C
01981       IX=IX+27
01982       IY=IY+27
01983       IZ=IZ+27
01984 C
01985       D(1,IX)=SPS*((BX1X+BX2X+BX3X+BX4X)*CPS+(BZ1X+BZ2X+BZ3X+BZ4X)*SPS)
01986       D(2,IX)=SPS*(BY1X+BY2X+BY3X+BY4X)
01987       D(3,IX)=SPS*((BZ1X+BZ2X+BZ3X+BZ4X)*CPS-(BX1X+BX2X+BX3X+BX4X)*SPS)
01988 C
01989       D(1,IY)=SPS*((BX1Y-BX2Y+BX3Y-BX4Y)*CPS+(BZ1Y-BZ2Y+BZ3Y-BZ4Y)*SPS)
01990       D(2,IY)=SPS*(BY1Y-BY2Y+BY3Y-BY4Y)
01991       D(3,IY)=SPS*((BZ1Y-BZ2Y+BZ3Y-BZ4Y)*CPS-(BX1Y-BX2Y+BX3Y-BX4Y)*SPS)
01992 C
01993       D(1,IZ)=SPS*((BX1Z+BX2Z-BX3Z-BX4Z)*CPS+(BZ1Z+BZ2Z-BZ3Z-BZ4Z)*SPS)
01994       D(2,IZ)=SPS*(BY1Z+BY2Z-BY3Z-BY4Z)
01995       D(3,IZ)=SPS*((BZ1Z+BZ2Z-BZ3Z-BZ4Z)*CPS-(BX1Z+BX2Z-BX3Z-BX4Z)*SPS)
01996   2   CONTINUE
01997 C
01998       DO 3 I=1,5
01999       ZD=ZZ(I+9)
02000       CALL DIPXYZ(XSM,Y,ZSM-ZD,BX1X,BY1X,BZ1X,BX1Y,BY1Y,BZ1Y,BX1Z,BY1Z,
02001      *  BZ1Z)
02002       CALL DIPXYZ(XSM,Y,ZSM+ZD,BX2X,BY2X,BZ2X,BX2Y,BY2Y,BZ2Y,BX2Z,BY2Z,
02003      *  BZ2Z)
02004        IX=58+I*2
02005        IZ=IX+1
02006       D(1,IX)=(BX1X-BX2X)*CPS+(BZ1X-BZ2X)*SPS
02007       D(2,IX)=BY1X-BY2X
02008       D(3,IX)=(BZ1X-BZ2X)*CPS-(BX1X-BX2X)*SPS
02009 C
02010       D(1,IZ)=(BX1Z+BX2Z)*CPS+(BZ1Z+BZ2Z)*SPS
02011       D(2,IZ)=BY1Z+BY2Z
02012       D(3,IZ)=(BZ1Z+BZ2Z)*CPS-(BX1Z+BX2Z)*SPS
02013 C
02014       IX=IX+10
02015       IZ=IZ+10
02016       D(1,IX)=SPS*((BX1X+BX2X)*CPS+(BZ1X+BZ2X)*SPS)
02017       D(2,IX)=SPS*(BY1X+BY2X)
02018       D(3,IX)=SPS*((BZ1X+BZ2X)*CPS-(BX1X+BX2X)*SPS)
02019 C
02020       D(1,IZ)=SPS*((BX1Z-BX2Z)*CPS+(BZ1Z-BZ2Z)*SPS)
02021       D(2,IZ)=SPS*(BY1Z-BY2Z)
02022   3   D(3,IZ)=SPS*((BZ1Z-BZ2Z)*CPS-(BX1Z-BX2Z)*SPS)
02023 C
02024             RETURN
02025             END
02026 C
02027 C$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$
02028 C
02029          SUBROUTINE  BIRK1SHLD(PS,X,Y,Z,BX,BY,BZ)
02030 C
02031 C - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
02032 C
02033 C  THE 64 LINEAR PARAMETERS ARE AMPLITUDES OF THE "BOX" HARMONICS.
02034 C THE 16 NONLINEAR PARAMETERS ARE THE SCALES PI, AND QK ENTERING THE ARGUMENTS
02035 C  OF SINES/COSINES AND EXPONENTS IN EACH OF  32 CARTESIAN HARMONICS
